text: Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt (every man and his household came thither with Jacob)
speaker: Narrator

text: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the souls, that came out of the loins of Jacob, were seventy souls: Joseph was in Egypt already.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joseph died and all his brethren, and that whole generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel brought forth fruit and increased in abundance, and were multiplied, and were exceeding mighty, so that the land was full of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there rose up a new King in Egypt, who knew not Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are greater, and mightier than we.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, let us work wisely with them, lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that if there be war, they join themselves also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and get them out of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore did they set taskmasters over them, to keep them under with burdens: and they built the cities Pithom and Raamses for the treasures of Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the more they vexed them, the more they multiplied and grew: therefore they were more grieved against the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore the Egyptians by cruelty caused the children of Israel to serve.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they made them weary of their lives by sore labor in clay and in brick, and in all work in the field, with all manner of bondage, which they laid upon them most cruelly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the King of Egypt commanded the midwives of the Hebrew women (of which the one’s name was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah)
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the women of the Hebrews, and see them on their stools, if it be a son, then ye shall kill him: but if it be a daughter, then let her live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding the midwives feared God, and did not as the King of Egypt commanded them, but preserved alive the men children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the King of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have ye done thus, and have preserved alive the men children?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the midwives answered Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the women of Egypt: for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come at them.
speaker: Narrator

text: God therefore prospered the midwives, and the people multiplied, and were very mighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because the midwives feared God, therefore he made them houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every man-child that is born, cast ye into the river, but reserve every maid-child alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there went a man of the house of Levi, and took to wife a daughter of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the woman conceived and bare a son: and when she saw that he was fair, she hid him three months.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when she could no longer hide him, she took for him an ark made of reed, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and laid the child therein, and put it among the bulrushes by the river’s brink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now his sister stood afar off, to wit what would come of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash her in the river, and her maidens walked by the river’s side: and when she saw the ark among the bulrushes, she sent her maid to fetch it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she opened it, and saw it was a child, and behold, the babe wept: so she had compassion on it, and said, This is one of the Hebrews’ children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said his sister unto Pharaoh’s daughter, Shall I go and call unto thee a nurse of the Hebrew women to nurse thee the child?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, Go. So the maid went and called the child’s mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom Pharaoh’s daughter said, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will reward thee. Then the woman took the child, and nursed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the child grew, and she brought him unto Pharaoh’s daughter, and he was as her son, and she called his name Moses, because, said she, I drew him out of the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in those days, when Moses was grown, he went forth unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens: also he saw an Egyptian smiting an Hebrew one of his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked round about, and when he saw no man, he slew the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he came forth the second day, and behold two Hebrews strove: and he said unto him that did the wrong, Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, Who made thee a man of authority, and a judge over us? Thinkest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian? Then Moses feared and said, Certainly this thing is known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Pharaoh heard this matter, and sought to slay Moses: therefore Moses fled from Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian, and he sat down by a well.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Priest of Midian had seven daughters, which came and drew water, and filled the troughs, for to water their father’s sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the shepherds came and drove them away: but Moses rose up, and defended them, and watered their sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How are ye come so soon today?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, A man of Egypt delivered us from the hand of the shepherds, and also drew us water enough, and watered the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto his daughters, And where is he? why have ye so left the man? call him that he may eat bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses agreed to dwell with the man: who gave unto Moses Zipporah his daughter:
speaker: Narrator

text: And she bare a son, whose name he called Gershom: for he said, I have been a stranger in a strange land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then in process of time, the King of Egypt died, and the children of Israel sighed for the bondage and cried: and their cry for the bondage came up unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God heard their moan, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: So God looked upon the children of Israel, and God had respect unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses kept the sheep of Jethro his father-in-law, Priest of Midian, and drove the flock to the back side of the desert, and came to the Mountain of God, Horeb,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush, and he looked, and behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Moses said, I will turn aside now, and see this great sight, why the bush burneth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord saw that he turned aside to see, God called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses, Moses. And he answered, I am here.
speaker: God

text: Then he said, Come not hither, put thy shoes off thy feet: for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.
speaker: God

text: Moreover he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. Then Moses hid his face: for he was afraid to look upon God.
speaker: God

text: Then the Lord said, I have surely seen the trouble of my people, which are in Egypt, and have heard their cry, because of their taskmasters: for I know their sorrows.
speaker: God

text: Therefore I am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them out of that land into a good land and a large, into a land that floweth with milk and honey, even into the place of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
speaker: God

text: And now lo, the cry of the children of Israel is come unto me, and I have also seen the oppression wherewith the Egyptians oppress them.
speaker: God

text: Come now therefore, and I will send thee unto Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring my people the children of Israel out of Egypt.
speaker: God

text: But Moses said unto God, Who am I, that I should go unto Pharaoh, and that I should bring the children of Israel out of Egypt?
speaker: God

text: And he answered, Certainly I will be with thee: and this shall be a token unto thee, that I have sent thee, After that thou hast brought the people out of Egypt, ye shall serve God upon this mountain.
speaker: God

text: Then Moses said unto God, Behold, when I shall come unto the children of Israel, and shall say unto them, The God of your fathers hath sent me unto you: if they say unto me, What is his Name? what shall I say unto them?
speaker: God

text: And God answered Moses, I AM THAT I AM. Also he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, I AM hath sent me unto you.
speaker: God

text: And God spake further unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, The Lord God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob hath sent me unto you: this is my Name forever, and this is my memorial unto all ages.
speaker: God

text: Go and gather the Elders of Israel together, and thou shalt say unto them, The Lord God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob appeared unto me, and said, I have surely remembered you, and that which is done to you in Egypt.
speaker: God

text: Therefore I did say, I will bring you out of the affliction of Egypt unto the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, unto a land that floweth with milk and honey.
speaker: God

text: Then shall they obey my voice, and thou and the Elders of Israel shall go unto the King of Egypt, and say unto him, The Lord God of the Hebrews hath met with us: we pray thee now therefore, let us go three days’ journey in the wilderness, that we may sacrifice unto the Lord our God.
speaker: God

text: But I know, that the King of Egypt will not let you go, but by strong hand.
speaker: God

text: Therefore will I stretch out mine hand and smite Egypt with all my wonders, which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that shall he let you go.
speaker: God

text: And I will make this people to be favored of the Egyptians: so that when ye go, ye shall not go empty.
speaker: God

text: For every woman shall ask of her neighbor, and of her that sojourneth in her house, jewels of silver and jewels of gold and raiment, and ye shall put them on your sons, and on your daughters, and shall spoil the Egyptians.
speaker: God

text: Then Moses answered, and said, But lo, they will not believe me, nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say, The Lord hath not appeared unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto him, What is that in thine hand? And he answered, A rod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he, Cast it on the ground. So he cast it on the ground, and it was turned into a serpent: and Moses fled from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord said unto Moses, Put forth thine hand, and take it by the tail. Then he put forth his hand and caught it, and it was turned into a rod in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do this that they may believe, that the Lord God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob hath appeared unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said furthermore unto him, Thrust now thine hand into thy bosom. And he thrust his hand into his bosom, and when he took it out again, behold his hand was leprous as snow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover he said, Put thine hand into thy bosom again. So he put his hand into his bosom again, and plucked it out of his bosom, and behold, it was turned again as his other flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall it be, if they will not believe thee, neither obey the voice of the first sign, yet shall they believe for the voice of the second sign.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they will not yet believe these two signs, neither obey unto thy voice, then shalt thou take of the water of the river, and pour it upon the dry land: so the water which thou shalt take out of the river, shall be turned to blood upon the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses said unto the Lord, Oh my Lord, I am not eloquent, neither at any time have been, nor yet since thou hast spoken unto thy servant: but I am slow of speech and slow of tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto him, Who hath given the mouth to man? or who hath made the dumb, or the deaf, or him that seeth, or the blind? have not I the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore go now, and I will be with thy mouth, and will teach thee what thou shalt say.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said, Oh my Lord, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him, whom thou shouldest send.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord was very angry with Moses, and said, Do not I know Aaron thy brother the Levite, that he himself shall speak? for lo, he cometh also forth to meet thee, and when he seeth thee, he will be glad in his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt speak unto him, and put the words in his mouth, and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye ought to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall be thy spokesman unto the people: and he shall be, even he shall be as thy mouth, and thou shalt be to him as God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover thou shalt take this rod in thine hand, wherewith thou shalt do miracles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Moses went and returned to Jethro his father-in-law, and said unto him, I pray thee, let me go, and return to my brethren, which are in Egypt, and see whether they be yet alive. Then Jethro said to Moses, Go in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the Lord had said unto Moses in Midian, Go, return to Egypt: for they are all dead which went about to kill thee.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses took his wife and his sons, and put them on an ass, and returned toward the land of Egypt, and Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, When thou art entered and come into Egypt again, see that thou do all the wonders before Pharaoh, which I have put in thine hand: but I will harden his heart, and he shall not let the people go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt say to Pharaoh, Thus saith the Lord, Israel is my son, even my firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore I say to thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me: if thou refuse to let him go, behold, I will slay thy son, even thy firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he was by the way in the Inn, the Lord met him, and would have killed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Zipporah took a sharp knife, and cut away the foreskin of her son, and cast it at his feet, and said, Thou art indeed a bloody husband unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he departed from him. Then she said, O bloody husband (because of the circumcision).
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Aaron, Go meet Moses in the wilderness. And he went and met him in the Mount of God, and kissed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses told Aaron all the words of the Lord, who had sent him, and all the signs wherewith he had charged him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So went Moses and Aaron, and gathered all the elders of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron told all the words, which the Lord had spoken unto Moses, and he did the miracles in the sight of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people believed, and when they heard that the Lord had visited the children of Israel, and had looked upon their tribulation, they bowed down, and worshipped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then afterward Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may celebrate a feast unto me in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said, Who is the Lord, that I should hear his voice, and let Israel go? I know not the Lord, neither will I let Israel go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, We worship the God of the Hebrews: we pray thee, let us go three days’ journey in the desert, and sacrifice unto the Lord our God, lest he bring upon us the pestilence or sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the King of Egypt unto them, Moses and Aaron, why cause ye the people to cease from their works? get you to your burdens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pharaoh said furthermore, Behold, much people is now in the land, and ye make them leave their burdens.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Pharaoh gave commandment the same day unto the taskmasters of the people, and to their officers, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall give the people no more straw, to make brick (as in time past) but let them go and gather them straw themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding lay upon them the number of brick, which they made in time past, diminish nothing thereof: for they be idle, therefore they cry, saying, Let us go to offer sacrifice unto our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lay more work upon the men, and cause them to do it, and let them not regard vain words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went the taskmasters of the people and their officers out, and told the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will give you no more straw.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go yourselves, get ye straw where ye can find it, yet shall nothing of your labor be diminished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then were the people scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt, for to gather stubble instead of straw.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the taskmasters hasted them, saying, Finish your day’s work every day’s task, as ye did when ye had straw.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Wherefore have ye not fulfilled your [task] in making brick yesterday and today, as in times past?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried unto Pharaoh, saying, Wherefore dealest thou thus thy servants?
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no straw given to thy servants, and they say unto us, Make brick: and lo, thy servants are beaten, and thy people is blamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said, Ye are too much idle: therefore ye say, Let us go to offer sacrifice to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go therefore now and work: for there shall no straw be given you, yet shall ye deliver the whole tale of brick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officers of the children of Israel saw themselves in an evil case, because it was said, Ye shall diminish nothing of your brick, nor of every day’s task.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they met Moses and Aaron, which stood in their way as they came out from Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: To whom they said, The Lord look upon you and judge: for ye have made our savor to stink before Pharaoh and before his servants, in that ye have put a sword in their hand to slay us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore Moses returned to the Lord, and said, Lord, why hast thou afflicted this people? wherefore hast thou thus sent me?
speaker: Narrator

text: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he hath vexed this people, and yet thou hast not delivered thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Moses, Now shalt thou see, what I will do unto Pharaoh: for by a strong hand shall he let them go, and even be constrained to drive them out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover God spake unto Moses, and said unto him, I am the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I appeared unto Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob by the Name of Almighty God, but by my Name Jehovah was I not known unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore as I made my covenant with them to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, wherein they were strangers:
speaker: Narrator

text: So I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage, and have remembered my covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore say thou unto the children of Israel, I am the Lord, and I will bring you out from the burdens of the Egyptians, and will deliver you out of their bondage, and will redeem you in a stretched out arm, and in great judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I will take you for my people, and will be your God: then ye shall know that I the Lord your God bring you out from the burdens of the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring you into the land which I sware that I would give to Abraham, and to Isaac, and to Jacob, and I will give it unto you for a possession: I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses told the children of Israel thus: but they hearkened not unto Moses, for anguish of spirit and for cruel bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go speak to Pharaoh King of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses spake before the Lord, saying, Behold, the children of Israel hearken not unto me, how then shall Pharaoh hear me, which am of uncircumcised lips?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, and charged them to go to the children of Israel and to Pharaoh King of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: These be the heads of their father’s houses: the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel are Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi: these are the families of Reuben.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Simeon: Jemuel and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman: these are the families of Simeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also are the names of the sons of Levi in their generations: Gershon and Kohath and Merari (and the years of the life of Levi were an hundred thirty and seven years).
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gershon were Libni and Shimi by their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Kohath, Amram and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel (and Kohath lived an hundred thirty and three years).
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi: these are the families of Levi their kindreds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Amram took Jochebed his father’s sister to his wife, and she bare him Aaron and Moses (and Amram lived an hundred thirty and seven years).
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Izhar: Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Uzziel: Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Zithri.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron took Elisheba daughter of Amminadab, sister of Nahshon to his wife, which bare him Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the sons of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah and Abiasaph: these are the families of the Korahites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eleazar Aaron’s son took him one of the daughters of Putiel to his wife, which bare him Phinehas: these are the principal fathers of the Levites throughout their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are Aaron and Moses to whom the Lord said, Bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt, according to their armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are that Moses, and Aaron, which spake to Pharaoh King of Egypt, that they might bring the children of Israel out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at that time when the Lord spake unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord, I say, spake unto Moses, saying, I am the Lord, speak thou unto Pharaoh the King of Egypt all that I say unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said before the Lord, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hear me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, Behold, I have made thee Pharaoh’s God, and Aaron thy brother shall be thy Prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt speak all that I commanded thee: and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, that he suffer the children of Israel to go out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will harden Pharaoh’s heart, and multiply my miracles, and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh shall not hearken unto you, that I may lay mine hand upon Egypt, and bring out mine armies, even my people, the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt, by great judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Egyptians shall know that I am the Lord, when I stretch forth mine hand upon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron did as the Lord commanded them, even so did they.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Moses was fourscore years old, and Aaron fourscore and three, when they spake unto Pharaoh.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord had spoken unto Moses and Aaron, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: If Pharaoh speak unto you, saying, Show a miracle for you, then thou shalt say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast it before Pharaoh, and it shall be turned into a serpent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went Moses and Aaron unto Pharaoh, and did even as the Lord had commanded, and Aaron cast forth his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it was turned into a serpent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh also called for the wise men and sorcerers: and those charmers also of Egypt did in like manner with their enchantments.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they cast down every man his rod, and they were turned into serpents: but Aaron’s rod devoured their rods.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he hearkened not to them, as the Lord had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord then said unto Moses, Pharaoh’s heart is obstinate, he refuseth to let the people go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go unto Pharaoh in the morning, (lo, he will come forth unto the water) and thou shalt stand and meet him by the river’s brink, and the rod, which was turned into a serpent, shalt thou take in thine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt say unto him, The Lord God of the Hebrews hath sent me unto thee, saying, Let my people go that they may serve me in the wilderness: and behold, hitherto thou wouldest not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, In this thou shalt know that I am the Lord: behold, I will smite with the rod that is in mine hand upon the water that is in the river, and it shall be turned into blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fish that is in the river shall die, and the river shall stink, and it shall grieve the Egyptians to drink of the water of the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord then spake to Moses, Say unto Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thine hand over the waters of Egypt, over their streams, over their rivers, and over their ponds, and over all pools of their waters, and they shall be blood, and there shall be blood throughout the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood, and of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron did even as the Lord commanded: and he lift up the rod, and smote the water that was in the river in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants: and all the water that was in the river, was turned into blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fish that was in the river died, and the river stank: so that the Egyptians could not drink of the water of the river: and there was blood throughout the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the enchanters of Egypt did likewise with their sorceries: and the heart of Pharaoh was hardened: so that he did not hearken unto them, as the Lord hath said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh returned, and went again into his house, neither did this yet enter into his heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Egyptians then dug round about the river for waters to drink: for they could not drink of the water of the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this continued fully seven days after the Lord had smitten the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the Lord said unto Moses, Go unto Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the Lord, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou wilt not let them go, behold, I will smite all thy country with frogs:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the river shall crawl full of frogs, which shall go up and come into thine house, and into thy chamber, where thou sleepest, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy ovens, and into thy kneading troughs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, the frogs shall climb up upon thee, and on thy people, and upon all thy servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Lord said to Moses, Say thou unto Aaron, Stretch out thine hand with thy rod upon the streams, upon the rivers, and upon the ponds, and cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron stretched out his hand upon the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sorcerers did likewise with their sorceries, and brought frogs up upon the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Pray ye unto the Lord, that he may take away the frogs from me, and from my people, and I will let the people go, that they may do sacrifice unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto Pharaoh, Concerning me, even command when I shall pray for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, to destroy the frogs from thee and from thine houses, that they may remain in the river only.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, Tomorrow. And he answered, Be it as thou hast said, that thou mayest know, that there is none like unto the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thine houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people: only they shall remain in the river.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh: and Moses cried unto the Lord concerning the frogs, which he had sent unto Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord did according to the saying of Moses: So the frogs died in the houses, in the towns, and the fields.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gathered them together by heaps, and the land stank of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Pharaoh saw that he had rest given him, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not unto them, as the Lord had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord said unto Moses, Say unto Aaron, Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the earth, that it may be turned to lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did so: for Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth: and lice came upon man and upon beast: all the dust of the earth was lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the enchanters assayed likewise with their enchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not. So the lice were upon man and upon beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the enchanters unto Pharaoh, This is the finger of God. But Pharaoh’s heart remained obstinate, and he hearkened not unto them, as the Lord had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the Lord said to Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh (lo, he will come forth unto the water) and say unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Else, if thou wilt not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies both upon thee, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thine houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and the ground also whereon they are.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the land of Goshen, where my people are, will I cause to be wonderful in that day, so that no swarms of flies shall be there, that thou mayest know that I am the Lord in the midst of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make a deliverance of my people from thy people: tomorrow shall this miracle be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord did so: for there came great swarms of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants’ houses, so that through all the land of Egypt, the earth was corrupt by the swarms of flies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Go, do sacrifice unto your God in this land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses answered, It is not meet to do so: for then we should offer unto the Lord our God that, which is an abomination unto the Egyptians. Lo, can we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, and they not stone us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us go three days’ journey in the desert, and sacrifice unto the Lord our God, as he hath commanded us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice unto the Lord your God in the wilderness: but go not far away, pray for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, Behold, I will go out from thee, and pray unto the Lord, that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people tomorrow: but let Pharaoh from henceforth deceive no more, in not suffering the people to sacrifice unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses went out from Pharaoh and prayed unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord did according to the saying of Moses, and the swarms of flies departed from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, and there remained not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also, and did not let the people go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Moses, Go to Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the Lord God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt yet hold them still,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thy flock which is in the field: for upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the cattle, and upon the sheep shall be a mighty great moraine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord shall do wonderfully between the beasts of Israel, and the beasts of Egypt: so that there shall nothing die at all, that pertaineth to the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord appointed a time, saying, Tomorrow the Lord shall finish this thing in this land.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord did this thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt died: but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh sent, and behold, there was not one of the cattle of the Israelites dead: and the heart of Pharaoh was obstinate, and he did not let the people go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to Moses and to Aaron, Take your handful of ashes of the furnace, and Moses shall sprinkle them toward the heaven in the sight of Pharaoh,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be turned to dust in all the land of Egypt: and it shall be as a scab breaking out into blisters upon man, and upon beast throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh: and Moses sprinkled them toward the heaven, and there came [a] scab breaking out into blisters upon man, and upon beast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sorcerers could not stand before Moses, because of the scab: for the scab was upon the enchanters and upon all the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them, as the Lord had said unto Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Lord said unto Moses, Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the Lord God of the Hebrews, Let my people go that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will at this time send my plagues upon thine heart, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, that thou mayest know that there is none like me in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For now I will stretch out mine hand, that I may smite thee and thy people with the pestilence: and thou shalt perish from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And indeed, for this cause have I appointed thee, to show my power in thee, and to declare my name throughout all the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet thou exaltest thyself against my people, and lettest them not go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, tomorrow this time I will cause to rain a mighty great hail, such as was not in Egypt since the foundation thereof was laid unto this time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send therefore now, and gather the cattle, and all that thou hast in the field: for upon all the men, and the beasts, which are found in the field, and not brought home, the hail shall fall upon them, and they shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such then as feared the word of the Lord among the servants of Pharaoh, made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But such as regarded not the word of the Lord, left his servants, and his cattle in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to Moses, Stretch forth thine hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon all the herbs of the field in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses stretched out his rod toward heaven, and the Lord sent thunder and hail, and lightning upon the ground: and the Lord caused hail to rain upon the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, so grievous, as there was none throughout all the land of Egypt, since it was a nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and beast: also the hail smote all the trees of the field and brake to pieces all the trees of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only in the land of Goshen (where the children of Israel were) was no hail.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh sent and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them, I have now sinned: the Lord is righteous, but I and my people are wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray ye unto the Lord (for it is enough) that there be no more mighty thunders, and hail, and I will let you go, and ye shall tarry no longer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said unto him, As soon as I am out of the city, I will spread mine hands unto the Lord, and the thunder shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail, that thou mayest know that the earth is the Lord’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for thee and thy servants, I know afore I pray, ye will fear before the face of the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And the flax, and the barley were smitten: for the barley was eared, and the flax was bolled.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wheat and the rye were not smitten, for they were hid in the ground.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread his hands to the Lord, and the thunder and the hail ceased, neither rained it upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunder were ceased, he sinned again, and hardened his heart, both he, and his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the heart of Pharaoh was hardened: neither would he let the children of Israel go, as the Lord had said by Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord said unto Moses, Go to Pharaoh, for I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants, that I might work these my miracles in the midst of his realm,
speaker: Narrator

text: And that thou mayest declare in the ears of thy son, and of thy son’s son, what things I have done in Egypt, and my miracles, which I have done among them: that ye may know that I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Moses and Aaron unto Pharaoh, and they said unto him, Thus saith the Lord God of the Hebrews, How long wilt thou refuse to humble thyself before me? Let my people go, that they may serve me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou refuse to let my people go, behold, tomorrow will I bring grasshoppers into thy coasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall cover the face of the earth, that a man cannot see the earth: and they shall eat the residue which remaineth unto you, and hath escaped from the hail: and they shall eat all your trees that bud in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall fill thine houses, and all thy servants’ houses, and the houses of all the Egyptians, as neither thy fathers, nor thy fathers’ fathers have seen, since the time they were upon the earth unto this day. So he returned, and went out from Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh’s servants said unto him, How long shall he be an offence unto us? let the men go, that they may serve the Lord their God: wilt thou first know that Egypt is destroyed?
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron were brought again unto Pharaoh, and he said unto them, Go, serve the Lord your God, but who are they that shall go?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses answered, We will go with our young, and with our old, with our sons, and with our daughters, with our sheep, and with our cattle will we go: for we must celebrate a feast unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Let the Lord so be with you, as I will let you go and your children: behold, for evil is before your face.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be so: now go ye that are men, and serve the Lord: for that was your desire. Then they were thrust out from Pharaoh’s presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, the Lord said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand upon the land of Egypt for the grasshoppers, that they may come upon the land of Egypt, and eat all the herbs of the land, even all that the hail had left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses stretched forth his rod upon the land of Egypt: and the Lord brought an East wind upon the land all that day, and all that night: and in the morning the East wind brought the grasshoppers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the grasshoppers went up upon all the land of Egypt, and remained in all quarters of Egypt: so grievous Grasshoppers, like to these were never before, neither after them shall be such.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they covered all the face of the earth, so that the land was dark: and they did eat all the herbs of the land, and all the fruits of the trees, which the hail had left, so that there was no green thing left upon the trees, nor among the herbs of the field throughout all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste, and said, I have sinned against the Lord your God, and against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now forgive me my sin only this once, and pray unto the Lord your God, that he may take away from me this death only.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses then went out from Pharaoh, and prayed unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord turned a mighty strong West wind, and took away the grasshoppers, and violently cast them into the red Sea, so that there remained not one grasshopper in all the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand toward heaven, that there may be upon the land of Egypt darkness, even darkness that may be felt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven, and there was a black darkness in all the land of Egypt three days.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man saw another, neither rose up from the place where he was for three days: but all the children of Israel had light where they dwelt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses, and said, Go serve the Lord: only your sheep and your cattle shall abide, and your children shall go with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, Thou must give us also sacrifices, and burnt offerings that we may do sacrifice unto the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore our cattle also shall go with us: there shall not an hoof be left, for thereof must we take to serve the Lord our God: neither do we know how we shall serve the Lord, until we come thither.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let them go.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh said unto him, Get thee from me: look thou see my face no more: for whensoever thou comest in my sight, thou shalt die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said, Thou hast said well: from henceforth will I see thy face no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord had said unto Moses, yet will I bring one plague more upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt, after that, he will let you go hence: when he letteth you go, he shall at once chase you hence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak thou now to the people, that every man require of his neighbor, and every woman of her neighbor, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians: also Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh’s servants, and in the sight of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, Thus saith the Lord, About midnight will I go out into the midst of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh that sitteth on his throne, unto the firstborn of the maid servant, that is at the mill, and all the firstborn of beasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as was never none like, nor shall be.
speaker: Narrator

text: But against none of the children of Israel shall a dog move his tongue, neither against man nor beast, that ye may know that the Lord putteth a difference between the Egyptians and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all these thy servants shall come down unto me, and fall before me, saying, Get thee out, and all the people that are at thy feet, and after this will I depart. So he went out from Pharaoh very angry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Pharaoh shall not hear you, that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: but the Lord hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he suffered not the children of Israel to go out of his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spake to Moses and to Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: This month shall be unto you the beginning of months: it shall be to you the first month of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak ye unto all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth of this month let every man take unto him a lamb, according to the house of the fathers, a lamb for an house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the household be too little for the lamb, he shall take his neighbor, which is next unto his house, according to the number of the persons: every one of you, according to his eating shall make your count for the lamb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of a year old: ye shall take it of the lambs, or of the kids.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall keep it until the fourteenth day of this month: then all the multitude of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at even.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, they shall take of the blood, and strike it on the two posts, and on the upper doorpost of the houses where they shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall eat the flesh that same night, roast with fire, and unleavened bread: with sour herbs they shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eat not thereof raw, boiled nor sodden in water, but roast with fire, both his head, his feet, and his purtenance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall reserve nothing of it unto the morning: but that, which remaineth of it unto the morrow shall ye burn with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thus shall ye eat it, Your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staves in your hands, and ye shall eat it in haste: for it is the Lord’s Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will pass through the land of Egypt the same night, and will smite all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both man and beast, and I will execute judgment upon all the gods of Egypt, I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the blood shall be a token for you upon the houses where ye are: so when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and the plague shall not be upon you to destruction, when I smite the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this day shall be unto you a remembrance: and ye shall keep it an holy feast unto the Lord, throughout your generations: ye shall keep it holy by an ordinance forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread, and in any case ye shall put away leaven the first day out of your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that person shall be cut off from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the first day shall be an holy assembly: also in the seventh day shall be an holy assembly unto you: no work shall be done in them, save about that which every man must eat: that only may ye do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall keep also the feast of unleavened bread: for that same day I will bring your armies out of the land of Egypt: therefore ye shall observe this day, throughout your posterity, by an ordinance forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the first month and the fourteenth day of the month at even, ye shall eat unleavened bread unto the one and twentieth day of the month at even.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven days shall no leaven be found in your houses: for whosoever eateth leavened bread, that person shall be cut off from the Congregation of Israel: whether he be a stranger, or born in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall eat no leavened bread: but in all your habitations shall ye eat unleavened bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses called all the Elders of Israel, and said unto them, Choose out and take you for every of your households a lamb, and kill the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel, and the door cheeks with the blood that is in the basin, and let none of you go out at the door of the house, until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord will pass by to smite the Egyptians: and when he seeth the blood upon the lintel and on the two door cheeks, the Lord will pass over the door, and will not suffer the destroyer to come into your houses to plague you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shall ye observe this thing as an ordinance, both for thee and thy sons forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye shall come into the land, which the Lord will give you, as he hath promised, then ye shall keep this service.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when your children ask you, What service is this ye keep?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of the Lord’s Passover, which passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and preserved our houses. Then the people bowed themselves and worshipped.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Israel went, and did as the Lord had commanded Moses and Aaron: so did they.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at midnight, the Lord smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh that sat on his throne, unto the firstborn of the captive that was in prison, and all the firstborn of beasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all his servants, and all the Egyptians: and there was a great cry in Egypt: for there was no house where there was not one dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called to Moses and to Aaron by night, and said, Rise up, get you out from among my people, both ye, and the children of Israel, and go serve the Lord as ye have said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take also your sheep and your cattle as ye have said, and depart, and bless me also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians did force the people, because they would send them out of the land in haste: for they said, We die all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the people took their dough before it was leavened, even their dough bound in clothes upon their shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel did according to the saying of Moses, and they asked of the Egyptians jewels of silver and jewels of gold, and raiment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians: and they granted their request: so they spoiled the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Israel took their journey from Rameses to Succoth about six hundred thousand men of foot, besides children.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a great multitude of sundry sorts of people went out with them, and sheep, and beeves, and cattle in great abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they baked the dough which they brought out of Egypt, and made unleavened cakes: for it was not leavened, because they were thrust out of Egypt, neither could they tarry, nor yet prepare themselves vittles.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the dwelling of the children of Israel, while they dwelled in Egypt, was four hundred and thirty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the four hundred and thirty years were expired, even the selfsame day departed all the hosts of the Lord out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a night to be kept holy to the Lord, because he brought them out of the land of Egypt: this is that night of the Lord, which all the children of Israel must keep throughout their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Lord said unto Moses and Aaron, This is the Law of the Passover: no stranger shall eat thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: But every servant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: A stranger or an hired servant shall not eat thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: In one house shall it be eaten: thou shalt carry none of the flesh out of the house, neither shall ye break a bone thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Congregation of Israel shall observe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if a stranger dwell with thee, and will observe the passover of the Lord, let him circumcise all the males, that belong unto him, and then let him come and observe it, and he shall be as one that is born in the land: for none uncircumcised person shall eat thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: One law shall be to him that is born in the land, and to the stranger that dwelleth among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the children of Israel did as the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron: so did they.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the selfsame day did the Lord bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sanctify unto me all the firstborn: that is, every one that first openeth the womb among the children of Israel, as well of man as of beast: for it is mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said unto the people, Remember this day in the which ye came out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage: for by a mighty hand the Lord brought you out from thence: therefore no leavened bread shall be eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: This day come ye out in the month of Abib.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the Lord hath brought thee into the land of the Canaanites, and Hittites, and Amorites, and Hivites, and Jebusites, (which he sware unto thy fathers, that he would give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey) then thou shalt keep this service in this month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread, and the seventh day shall be the feast of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days, and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, nor yet leaven be seen with thee in all thy quarters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt show thy son in that day, saying, This is done, because of that which the Lord did unto me, when I came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be a sign unto thee upon thine hand, and for a remembrance between thine eyes, that the Law of the Lord may be in thy mouth: for by a strong hand the Lord brought thee out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep therefore this ordinance in his season appointed from year to year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites, as he sware unto thee and to thy fathers, and shall give it thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou set apart unto the Lord all that first openeth the womb: also everything that first doth open the womb, and cometh forth of thy beast: the males shall be the Lord’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: But every first foal of an ass, thou shalt redeem with a lamb: and if thou redeem him not, then shalt thou break his neck: likewise also the firstborn of man among thy sons shalt thou buy out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when thy son shall ask thee tomorrow, saying, What is this? thou shalt then say unto him, With a mighty hand the Lord brought us out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when Pharaoh was hard hearted against our departing, the Lord then slew all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of man even to the firstborn of beast: therefore I sacrifice unto the Lord all the males that first open the womb, but all the firstborn of my sons I redeem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be as a token upon thine hand, and as frontlets between thine eyes, that the Lord brought us out of Egypt by a mighty hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Pharaoh had let the people go, God carried them not by the way of the Philistines’ country, though it were nearer: (for God said, Lest the people repent when they see war, and turn again to Egypt).
speaker: Narrator

text: But God made the people to go about by the way of the wilderness of the red sea: and the children of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had made the children of Israel swear, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall take my bones away hence with you.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So they took their journey from Succoth, and camped in Etham in the edge of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud to lead them the way, and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light, that they might go both by day and by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took not away the pillar of the cloud by day, nor the pillar of fire by night from before the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel, that they return and camp before Pi Hahiroth, between Migdol and the Sea, over against Baal Zephon: about it shall ye camp by the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are tangled in the land: the wilderness hath shut them in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart that he shall follow after you: so I will get me honor upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host: the Egyptians also shall know that I am the Lord: and they did so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it was told the king of Egypt, that the people fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was turned against the people, and they said, Why have we this done, and have let Israel go out of our service?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made ready his chariots, and took his people with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: And took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, and captains over every one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the Lord had hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he followed after the children of Israel: but the children of Israel went out with an high hand.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians pursued after them, and all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen and his host overtook them camping by the Sea, beside Pi Hahiroth, before Baal Zephon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Pharaoh drew nigh, the children of Israel lift up their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians marched after them, and they were sore afraid: wherefore the children of Israel cried unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto Moses, Hast thou brought us to die in the wilderness, because there were no graves in Egypt? wherefore hast thou served us thus, to carry us out of Egypt?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not we tell thee this thing in Egypt, saying, Let us be in rest, that we may serve the Egyptians? for it had been better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said to the people, Fear ye not, stand still, and behold the salvation of the Lord which he will show to you this day. For the Egyptians whom ye have seen this day, ye shall never see them again.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall fight for you: therefore hold you your peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Wherefore cryest thou unto me? speak unto the children of Israel, that they go forward:
speaker: Narrator

text: And lift thou up thy rod, and stretch out thine hand upon the Sea and divide it, and let the children of Israel go on dry ground through the midst of the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, behold, I will harden the heart of the Egyptians, that they may follow them, and I will get me honor upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Egyptians shall know that I am the Lord, when I have gotten me honor upon Pharaoh, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And the Angel of God, which went before the host of Israel, removed, and went behind them: also the pillar of the cloud went from before them, and stood behind them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel: it was both a cloud and darkness, yet gave it light by night, so that all the night long the one came not at the other.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses stretched forth his hand upon the Sea, and the Lord caused the Sea to run back by a strong East wind all the night, and made the Sea dry land: for the waters were divided.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Israel went through the midst of the Sea upon the dry ground, and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians pursued and went after them to the midst of the Sea, even all Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, in the morning watch, when the Lord looked unto the host of the Egyptians, out of the fiery and cloudy pillar, he struck the host of the Egyptians with fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he took off their chariot wheels, and they drove them with much ado: so that the Egyptians every one said, I will flee from the face of Israel: for the Lord fighteth for them against the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, Stretch thine hand upon the Sea, that the waters may return upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots and upon their horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses stretched forth his hand upon the Sea, and the Sea returned to his force early in the morning, and the Egyptians fled against it: but the Lord overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the water returned and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, even all the host of Pharaoh that came into the Sea after them: there remained not one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the children of Israel walked upon dry land through the midst of the Sea, and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the Lord saved Israel the same day out of the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the Sea bank.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel saw the mighty power, which the Lord showed upon the Egyptians: so the people feared the Lord, and believed the Lord, and his servant Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the Lord, and said in this manner, I will sing unto the Lord: for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and him that rode upon him hath he overthrown in the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is my strength, and praise, and he is become my salvation. He is my God, and I will prepare him a tabernacle: he is my father’s God, and I will exalt him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is a man of war, his Name is Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pharaoh’s chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea: his chosen captains also were drowned in the red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The depths have covered them, they sank to the bottom as a stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy right hand, O Lord, is glorious in power: thy right hand, O Lord, hath bruised the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in thy great glory thou hast overthrown them that rose against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as the stubble.
speaker: Narrator

text: And by the blast of thy nostrils the waters were gathered, the floods stood still as an heap, the depths congealed together in the heart of the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake them, I will divide the spoil, my lust shall be satisfied upon them, I will draw my sword, mine hand shall destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou blewest with thy wind, the sea covered them, they sank as lead in the mighty waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is like unto thee, O Lord, among the gods! Who is like thee so glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders!
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou stretchedst out thy right hand, the earth swallowed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou wilt by thy mercy carry this people, which thou deliveredst, thou wilt bring them in thy strength unto thine holy habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people shall hear and be afraid: sorrow shall come upon the inhabitants of Philistia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the dukes of Edom shall be amazed, and trembling shall come upon the great men of Moab: all the inhabitants of Canaan shall wax faint hearted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear and dread shall fall upon them: because of the greatness of thine arm, they shall be still as a stone, till thy people pass, O Lord: till this people pass, which thou hast purchased.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance, which is the place that thou hast prepared, O Lord, for to dwell in, even the sanctuary, O Lord, which thine hands shall establish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shall reign forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Pharaoh’s horses went with his chariots and horsemen into the sea, and the Lord brought the waters of the sea upon them: but the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Miriam the Prophetess, sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand, and all the women came out after her with timbrels and dances.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Miriam answered the men, Sing ye unto the Lord: for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath he overthrown in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses brought Israel from the red sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur: and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter: therefore the name of the place was called Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cried unto the Lord, and the Lord showed him a tree, which when he had cast into the waters, the waters were sweet: there he made them an ordinance and a law, and there he proved them,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, If thou wilt diligently hearken, O Israel, unto the voice of the Lord thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his sight, and wilt give ear unto his commandments, and keep all his ordinances, then will I put none of these diseases upon thee, which I brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the Lord that healeth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Elim, where were twelve fountains of water, and seventy palm trees, and they camped there by the waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward all the Congregation of the children of Israel departed from Elim, and came to the wilderness of Sin, (which is between Elim and Sinai) the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole Congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses, and against Aaron in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the children of Israel said to them, Oh that we had died by the hand of the Lord in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh pots, when we ate bread our bellies full: for ye have brought us out into this wilderness, to kill this whole company with famine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord unto Moses, Behold, I will cause bread to rain from heaven to you, and the people shall go out, and gather that that is sufficient for every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law or no.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the sixth day they shall prepare that, which they shall bring home, and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron said unto all the children of Israel, At even ye shall know, that the Lord brought you out of the land of Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the morning ye shall see the glory of the Lord: for he hath heard your grudgings against the Lord: and what are we that ye have murmured against us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, Moses said, At even shall the Lord give you flesh to eat, and in the morning your fill of bread: for the Lord hath heard your murmurings, which ye murmur against him: for what are we? your murmurings are not against us, but against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to Aaron, Say unto all the Congregation of the children of Israel, Draw near before the Lord: for he hath heard your murmurings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as Aaron spake unto the whole Congregation of the children of Israel, they looked toward the wilderness, and behold, the glory of the Lord appeared in a cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the Lord had spoken unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel: tell them therefore, and say, At even ye shall eat flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread, and ye shall know that I am the Lord your God.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And so at even the quails came and covered the camp: and in the morning the dew lay round about the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the dew that was fallen was ascended, behold, a small round thing was upon the face of the wilderness, small as the hoary frost upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another, It is Manna, for they wist not what it was. And Moses said unto them, This is the bread which the Lord hath given you to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the thing which the Lord hath commanded: gather of it every man according to his eating, an omer for a man according to the number of your persons: every man shall take for them which are in his tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel did so, and gathered, some more, some less.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they did measure it with an omer, he that had gathered much, had nothing over, and he that had gathered little, had no lack: so every man gathered according to his eating.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses then said unto them, Let no man reserve thereof till morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, they obeyed not Moses: but some of them reserved of it till morning, and it was full of worms, and stank: therefore Moses was angry with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gathered it every morning, every man according to his eating: for when the heat of the sun came, it was melted.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sixth day they gathered twice so much bread, two omers for one man: then all the rulers of the Congregation came and told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered them, This is that which the Lord hath said, Tomorrow is the rest of the holy Sabbath unto the Lord: bake that today which ye will bake, and seethe that which ye will seethe, and all that remaineth, lay it up to be kept till the morning for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade, and it stank not, neither was there any worm therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said, Eat that today: for today is the Sabbath unto the Lord: today ye shall not find it in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shall ye gather it, but in the seventh day is the Sabbath: in it there shall be none.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, there went out some of the people in the seventh day for to gather, and they found none.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, How long refuse ye to keep my commandments, and my laws?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, how the Lord hath given you the Sabbath: therefore he giveth you the sixth day bread for two days: tarry therefore every man in his place: let no man go out of his place the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people rested the seventh day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the house of Israel called the name of it Manna, and it was like to coriander seed, but white: and the taste of it was like unto wafers made with honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said, This is that which the Lord had commanded, Fill an omer of it, to keep it for your posterity: that they may see the bread wherewith I have fed you in wilderness, when I brought you out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses also said to Aaron, Take a pot and put an omer full of Manna therein, and set it before the Lord to be kept for your posterity.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony to be kept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel did eat Manna forty years, until they came unto a land inhabited: they did eat Manna until they came to the borders of the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The omer is the tenth part of the Ephah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the Congregation of the children of Israel departed from the wilderness of Sin, by their journeys at the commandment of the Lord, and camped in Rephidim, where was no water for the people to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore the people contended with Moses, and said, Give us water, that we may drink. And Moses said unto them, Why contend ye with me? wherefore do ye tempt the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people thirsted there for water, and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore hast thou thus brought us out of Egypt, to kill us, and our children, and our cattle with thirst?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses cried unto the Lord, saying, What shall I do to this people? for they be almost ready to stone me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord answered to Moses, Go before the people, and take with thee of the Elders of Israel: and thy rod wherewith thou smotest the river, take in thine hand, and go:
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will stand there before thee upon the rock in Horeb, and thou shalt smite on the rock, and water shall come out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the Elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he called the name of the place Massah and Meribah, because of the contention of the children of Israel, and because they had tempted the Lord, saying, Is the Lord among us, or no?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Amalek and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said to Joshua, Choose us out men, and go fight with Amalek: tomorrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in mine hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua did as Moses bade him, and fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur, went up to the top of the hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses held up his hand, Israel prevailed: but when he let his hand down, Amalek prevailed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Moses’ hands were heavy: therefore they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat upon it: and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side: so his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to Moses, Write this for a remembrance in the book, and rehearse it to Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: (And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovah Nissi.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he said, The Lord hath sworn, that he will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jethro the Priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, and how the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jethro the father-in-law of Moses, took Zipporah Moses’ wife, (after he had sent her away)
speaker: Narrator

text: And her two sons, (whereof the one was called Gershom: for he said, I have been an alien in a strange land:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of the other was Eliezer: for the God of my father, said he, was mine help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh).
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jethro Moses’ father-in-law came with his two sons, and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness, where he camped by the mount of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to Moses, I thy father-in-law Jethro am come to thee, and thy wife and her two sons with her.
speaker: Narrator
