text: And Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and did obeisance, and kissed him, and each asked other of his welfare: and they came into the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses told his father-in-law all that the Lord had done unto Pharaoh, and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, and all the travail that had come unto them by the way, and how the Lord delivered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jethro rejoiced at all the goodness, which the Lord had showed to Israel, and because he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Jethro said, Blessed be the Lord who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh: who hath also delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I know that the Lord is greater than all the gods: for as they have dealt proudly with them, so are they recompensed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jethro Moses’ father-in-law took burnt offerings and sacrifices, to offer unto God. And Aaron and all the Elders of Israel came to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now on the morrow, when Moses sat to judge the people, the people stood about Moses from morning unto even.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand about thee from morning unto even?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto his father-in-law, Because the people come unto me to seek God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they have a matter, they come unto me, and I judge between one and another, and declare the ordinances of God, and his laws.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses’ father-in-law said unto him, The thing which thou doest, is not well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou both weariest thyself greatly, and this people that is with thee: for the thing is too heavy for thee: thou art not able to do it thyself alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear now my voice, (I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee) be thou for the people to Godward, and report thou the causes unto God,
speaker: Narrator

text: And admonish them of the ordinances, and of the laws, and show them the way, wherein they must walk, and the work that they must do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, provide thou among all the people men of courage, fearing God, men dealing truly, hating covetousness: and appoint such over them to be rulers over thousands, rulers over hundreds, rulers over fifties, and rulers over tens.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let them judge the people at all seasons: but every great matter let them bring unto thee, and let them judge all small causes: so shall it be easier for thee, when they shall bear the burden with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou do this thing, (and God so command thee) both thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go quietly to their place.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses obeyed the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said:
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses chose men of courage out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers over thousands, rulers over hundreds, rulers over fifties, and rulers over tens.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they judged the people at all seasons, but they brought the hard causes to Moses: for they judged all small matters themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went into his country.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the third month, after the children of Israel were gone out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they into the wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they departed from Rephidim, and came to the desert of Sinai, and camped in the wilderness, even there Israel camped before the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses went up unto God, for the Lord had called out of the mount unto him, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and how I carried you upon eagle’s wings, and have brought you unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore if ye will hear my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be my chief treasure above all people, though all the earth be mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall be unto me also a kingdom of Priests, and an holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses then came and called for the Elders of the people, and proposed unto them all these things, which the Lord commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people answered all together, and said, All that the Lord hath commanded, we will do. And Moses reported the words of the people unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear while I talk with thee, and that they may also believe thee forever. (For Moses had told the words of the people unto the Lord.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the Lord said unto Moses, Go to the people, and sanctify them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let them be ready on the third day: for the third day the Lord will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set marks unto the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, that ye go not up to the mount, nor touch the border of it, whosoever toucheth the mount, shall surely die.
speaker: Narrator

text: No hand shall touch it, but he shall be stoned to death, or stricken through with darts: whether it be beast or man, he shall not live: when the horn bloweth long, they shall come up into the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went down from the mount unto the people, and sanctified the people, and they washed their clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto the people, Be ready on the third day, and come not at your wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the third day, when it was morning, there was thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the sound of the trumpet exceeding loud, so that all the people that was in the camp was afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses brought the people out of the tents to meet with God, and they stood in the nether part of the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: And mount Sinai was all on smoke, because the Lord came down upon it in fire, and the smoke thereof ascended, as the smoke of a furnace, and all the mount trembled exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the sound of the trumpet blew long, and waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the Lord came down upon mount Sinai on the top of the mount) and when the Lord called Moses up into the top of the mount, Moses went up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Moses, Go down, charge the people, that they break not their bounds, to go up to the Lord to gaze, lest many of them perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let the Priests also which come to the Lord be sanctified, lest the Lord destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses said unto the Lord, The people cannot come up into the mount Sinai: for thou hast charged us, saying, Set marks on the mountain, and sanctify it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto him, Go, get thee down, and come up thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the Priests and the people break their bounds to come up unto the Lord, lest he destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses went down unto the people, and told them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then God spake all these words, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the Lord thy God, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt have none other gods before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make thee no graven image, neither any similitude of things that are in heaven above, neither that are in the earth beneath, nor that are in the waters under the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not bow down to them, neither serve them: for I am the Lord thy God, a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, upon the third generation and upon the fourth of them that hate me:
speaker: Narrator

text: And showing mercy unto thousands to them that love me, and keep my commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not take the Name of the Lord thy God in vain: for the Lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh his Name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work,
speaker: Narrator

text: But the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy manservant, nor thy maid, nor thy beast, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in six days the Lord made the heaven and the earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seventh day: therefore the Lord blessed the seventh day, and hallowed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor thy father and thy mother, that thy days may be prolonged upon the land, which the Lord thy God giveth thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not kill.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not commit adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not steal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor’s house, neither shalt thou covet thy neighbor’s wife, nor his manservant, nor his maid, nor his ox, nor his ass, neither anything that is thy neighbor’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people saw the thunders: and the lightnings, and the sound of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking, and when the people saw it, they fled and stood afar off,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto Moses, Talk thou with us, and we will hear: but let not God talk with us, lest we die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said unto the people, Fear not: for God is come to prove you, and that his fear may be before you, that ye sin not.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people stood afar off, but Moses drew near unto the darkness where God was.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Thus thou shalt say unto the children of Israel, Ye have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not make therefore with me gods of silver, nor gods of gold: you shall make you none.
speaker: Narrator

text: An altar of earth thou shalt make unto me, and thereon shalt offer thy burnt offerings, and thy peace offerings, thy sheep, and thine oxen: in all places, where I shall put the remembrance of my Name, I will come unto thee, and bless thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou wilt make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build it of hewn stones: for if thou lift up thy tool upon them, thou hast polluted them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shalt thou go up by steps unto mine altar, that thy filthiness be not discovered thereon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the laws, which thou shalt set before them:
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou buy an Hebrew servant, he shall serve six years, and in the seventh he shall go out free for nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he came himself alone, he shall go out himself alone: if he were married, then his wife shall go out with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If his master hath given him a wife and she hath borne him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall be her master’s, but he shall go out himself alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the servant say thus, I love my master, my wife and my children, I will not go out free,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his master shall bring him unto the Judges, and set him to the door, or to the post, and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl, and he shall serve him forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise if a man sell his daughter to be a servant, she shall not go out as the menservants do.
speaker: Narrator

text: If she please not her master, who hath betrothed her to himself, then shall he cause to buy her: he shall have no power to sell her to a strange people, seeing he despised her.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he hath betrothed her unto his son, he shall deal with her according to the custom of the daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he take him another wife, he shall not diminish her food, her raiment, and recompense of her virginity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he do not these three unto her, then shall she go out free, paying no money.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that smiteth a man, and he die, shall die the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man hath not laid wait, but God hath offered him into his hand, then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbor to slay him with guile, thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he that smiteth his father or his mother, shall die the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, if it be found with him, shall die the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that curseth his father or his mother, shall die the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: When men also strive together, and one smite another with a stone, or with the fist, and he die not but lieth in bed.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he rise again and walk without upon his staff, then shall he that smote him go quit, save only he shall bear his charges for his resting, and shall pay for his healing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man smite his servant, or his maid with a rod, and he die under his hand, he shall be surely punished.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if he continue a day or two days, he shall not be punished: for he is his money.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also if men strive and hurt a woman with child, so that her child depart from her and death follow not, he shall be surely punished, according as the woman’s husband shall appoint him, or he shall pay as the Judges determine.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if death follow, then thou shalt pay life for life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
speaker: Narrator

text: Burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man smite his servant in the eye, or his maid in the eye, and hath perished it, he shall let him go free for his eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also if he smite out his servant’s tooth, or his maid’s tooth, he shall let him go out free for his tooth.
speaker: Narrator

text: If an ox gore a man or a woman that he die, the ox shall be stoned to death, and his flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the ox shall go quite.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the ox were wont to push in times past, and it hath been told his master, and he hath not kept him, and after he killeth a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned, and his owner shall die also.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there be set to him a sum of money, then he shall pay the ransom of his life, whatsoever shall be laid upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whether he hath gored a son, or gored a daughter, he shall be judged after the same manner.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the ox gore a servant or a maid, he shall give unto their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when a man shall open a well, or when he shall dig a pit and cover it not, and an ox or an ass fall therein,
speaker: Narrator

text: The owner of the pit shall make it good, and give money to the owner thereof, but the dead beast shall be his.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man’s ox hurt his neighbor’s ox that he die, then they shall sell the live ox, and divide the money thereof, and the dead ox also they shall divide.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if it be known that the ox hath used to push in times past, and his master hath not kept him, he shall pay ox for ox, but the dead shall be his own.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man steal an ox or a sheep, and kill it or sell it, he shall restore five oxen for the ox, and four sheep for the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a thief be found breaking up, and be smitten that he die, no blood shall be shed for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if it be in the daylight, blood shall be shed for him: for he should make full restitution: if he had not wherewith, then should he be sold for his theft.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the theft be found with him alive, (whether it be ox, ass, or sheep) he shall restore the double.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man do hurt field, or vineyard, and put in his beast to feed in another man’s field, he shall recompense of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: If fire break out, and catch in the thorns, and the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field be consumed, he that kindled the fire shall make full restitution.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man deliver his neighbor money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of his house, if the thief be found, he shall pay the double.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall be brought unto the Judges to swear, whether he hath put his hand unto his neighbor’s good, or no.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all manner of trespass, whether it be for oxen, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing which another challengeth to be his, the cause of both parties shall come before the judges, and whom the Judges condemn, he shall pay the double unto the neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man deliver unto his neighbor to keep ass, or ox, or sheep, or any beast, and it die, or be hurt, or taken away by enemies, and no man see it,
speaker: Narrator

text: An oath of the Lord shall be between them twain, that he hath not put his hand unto his neighbor’s good, and the owner of it shall take the oath, and he shall not make it good:
speaker: Narrator

text: But if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitution unto the owner thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: If it be torn in pieces, he shall bring record, and shall not make that good, which is devoured.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man borrow ought of his neighbor, and it be hurt, or else die, the owner thereof not being by, he shall surely make it good.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the owner thereof be by, he shall not make it good: for if it be an hired thing, it came for his hire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a man entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall endow her, and take her to his wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: If her father refuse to give her to him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever lieth with a beast, shall die the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that offereth unto any gods, save unto the Lord only, shall be slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, thou shalt not do injury to a stranger, neither oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall not trouble any widow, nor fatherless child.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou vex or trouble such, and so he call and cry unto me, I will surely hear his cry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall my wrath be kindled, and I will kill you with the sword, and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou lend money to my people, that is, to the poor with thee, thou shalt not be as an usurer unto him: ye shall not oppress him with usury.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou take thy neighbor’s raiment to pledge, thou shalt restore it unto him before the sun go down.
speaker: Narrator

text: For that is his covering only, and this is his garment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? therefore when he crieth unto me, I will hear him: for I am merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not rail upon the Judges, neither speak evil of the ruler of thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine abundance and thy liquor shalt thou not keep back. The firstborn of thy sons shalt thou give me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with his dam, and the eighth day thou shalt give it me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall be an holy people unto me, neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field: ye shall cast it to the dog.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not receive a false tale, neither shalt thou put thine hand with the wicked, to be a false witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil, neither agree in a controversy to decline after many and overthrow the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not esteem a poor man in his cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou meet thine enemy’s ox, or his ass going astray, thou shalt bring him to him again.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou see thine enemy’s ass lying under his burden, wilt thou cease to help him? thou shalt help him up again with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not overthrow the right of the poor in his suit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep thee far from a false matter, thou shalt not slay the innocent and the righteous: for I will not justify a wicked man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not oppress a stranger: for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, six years thou shalt sow thy land, and gather the fruits thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and lie still, that the poor of thy people may eat, and what they leave, the beasts of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt do with thy vineyard, and with thine olive trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days thou shalt do thy work, and in the seventh day thou shalt rest, that thine ox, and thine ass may rest, and the son of thy maid, and the stranger may be refreshed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall take heed to all things that I have said unto you: and ye shall make no mention of the name of other gods, neither shall it be heard out of thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times shalt thou keep a feast unto me in the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt keep the feast of unleavened bread: thou shalt eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded thee, in the season of the month of Abib: for in it thou camest out of Egypt: and none shall appear before me empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The feast also of the harvest of the first fruits of thy labors, which thou hast sown in the field: and the feast of gathering fruits in the end of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labors out of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: These three times in the year shall all thy men children appear before the Lord Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread: neither shall the fat of my sacrifice remain until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first of the firstfruits of thy land, thou shalt bring into the house of the Lord thy God: yet shalt thou not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in thy way, and to bring thee to the place which I have prepared.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware of him, and hear his voice, and provoke him not: for he will not spare your misdeeds, because my name is in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou hearken unto his voice, and do all that I speak, then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and will afflict them that afflict thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine Angel shall go before thee, and bring thee unto the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I will destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, neither serve them, nor do after the works of them: but utterly overthrow them, and break in pieces their images.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye shall serve the Lord your God, and he shall bless thy bread and thy water, and I will take all sickness away from the midst of thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall none cast their fruit, nor be barren in thy land, the number of thy days will I fulfill.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will send my fear before thee, and will destroy all the people among whom thou shalt go: and I will make all thine enemies turn their backs unto thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send hornets before thee, which shall drive out the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites from thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will not cast them out from thy face in one year, lest the land grow to a wilderness, and the beasts of the field multiply against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: By little and little I will drive them out from thy face, until thou increase, and inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make thy coasts from the red sea unto the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert unto the River: for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and thou shalt drive them out from thy face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods:
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall they dwell in the land, lest they make thee sin against me: for if thou serve their gods, surely it shall be thy destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he had said unto Moses, Come up to the Lord, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the Elders of Israel, and ye shall worship afar off.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses himself alone shall come near to the Lord, but they shall not come near, neither shall the people go up with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward Moses came and told the people all the words of the Lord, and all the Laws: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the things which the Lord hath said, will we do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses wrote all the words of the Lord and rose up early, and set up an altar under the mountain, and twelve pillars according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent young men of the children of Israel, which offered burnt offerings of beeves, and sacrificed peace offerings unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basins, and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, he took the book of the covenant, and read it in the audience of the people: who said, All that the Lord hath said, we will do, and be obedient.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which the Lord hath made with you concerning all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the Elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they saw the God of Israel, and under his feet was as it were a work of a Sapphire stone, and as the very heaven when it is clear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: also they saw God, and did eat and drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mountain, and be there, and I will give thee tables of stone, and the Law, and the Commandment, which I have written, for to teach them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses rose up, and his minister Joshua, and Moses went up into the mountain of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto the Elders, Tarry us here until we come again unto you: and behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: whosoever hath any matters, let him come to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went up to the mount, and the cloud covered the mountain,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the glory of the Lord abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sight of the glory of the Lord was like consuming fire on the top of the mountain, in the eyes of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses entered into the midst of the cloud, and went up to the mountain and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak unto the children of Israel that they receive an offering for me: of every man, whose heart giveth it freely, ye shall take the offering for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the offering which ye shall take of them, gold and silver, and brass,
speaker: Narrator

text: And blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen and goat’s hair,
speaker: Narrator

text: And ram’s skins colored red, and the skins of badgers, and the wood Shittim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Oil for the light, spices for anointing oil, and for the perfume of sweet savor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Onyx stones, and stones to be set in the Ephod, and in the breastplate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they shall make me a Sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to all that I show thee, even so shall ye make the form of the Tabernacle, and the fashion of all the instruments thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall make also an Ark of Shittim wood, two cubits and an half long, and a cubit and an half broad, and a cubit and an half high.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without shalt thou overlay it, and shalt make upon it a crown of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in the four corners thereof: that is, two rings shall be on the one side of it, and two rings on the other side thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make bars of Shittim wood, and cover them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt put the bars in the rings by the sides of the Ark, to bear the Ark with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bars shall be in the rings of the Ark: they shall not be taken away from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So thou shalt put in the Ark the Testimony, which I shall give thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make a Mercy seat of pure gold, two cubits and an half long and a cubit and an half broad.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make two Cherubims of gold: of work beaten out with the hammer shalt thou make them at the two ends of the Mercy seat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the one Cherub shalt thou make at the one end, and the other Cherub at the other end: of the matter of the Mercy seat shall ye make the Cherubims, on the two ends thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Cherubims shall stretch their wings on high, covering the Mercy seat with their wings and their faces one to another: to the Mercy seatward shall the faces of the Cherubims be.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put the Mercy seat above upon the Ark, and in the Ark thou shalt put the Testimony, which I will give thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there I will declare myself unto thee, and from above the Mercy seat between the two Cherubims, which are upon the Ark of the Testimony, I will tell thee all things which I will give thee in commandment unto the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make a Table of Shittim wood, of two cubits long, and one cubit broad, and a cubit and a half high:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cover it with pure gold, and make thereto a crown of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make unto it a border of four fingers round about: and thou shalt make a golden crown round about the border thereof:
speaker: Narrator

text: After, thou shalt make for it four rings of gold, and shalt put the rings in the four corners that are in the four feet thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over against the border shall the rings be for places for bars to bear the Table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the bars of Shittim wood, and shalt overlay them with gold, that the Table may be borne with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make also dishes for it, and incense cups for it, and coverings for it, and goblets, wherewith it shall be covered, even of fine gold shalt thou make them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set upon the Table Showbread before me continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make a candlestick of pure gold: of work beaten out with the hammer shall the Candlestick be made, his shaft, and his branches, his bowls, his knops: and his flowers shall be of the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six branches also shall come out of the sides of it: three branches of the candlestick out of the one side of it, and three branches of the Candlestick out of the other side of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three bowls like unto almonds, one knop and one flower in one branch: and three bowls like almonds in the other branch, one knop and one flower: so throughout the six branches that come out of the Candlestick.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the shaft of the Candlestick shall be four bowls like unto almonds, his knops and his flowers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall be a knop under two branches made thereof: and a knop under two branches made thereof: and a knop under two branches made thereof, according to the six branches coming out of the Candlestick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their knops and their branches shall be thereof: all this shall be one beaten work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the seven lamps thereof: and the lamps thereof shalt thou put thereon, to give light toward that that is before it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the snuffers and snuffdishes thereof shall be of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of a talent of fine gold shalt thou make it with all these instruments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look therefore that thou make them after their fashion, that was showed thee in the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward thou shalt make the Tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen and blue silk, and purple, and scarlet: and in them thou shalt make Cherubims of broidered work.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain shall be eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: every one of the curtains shall have one measure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Five curtains shall be coupled one to another: and the other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make strings of blue silk upon the edge of the one curtain, which is in the selvedge of the coupling: and likewise shall thou make in the edge of the other curtain in the selvedge, in the second coupling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fifty strings shalt thou make in one curtain, and fifty strings shalt thou make in the edge of the curtain, which is in the second coupling: the strings shall be one right against another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make also fifty taches of gold, and couple the curtains one to another with the taches, and it shall be one Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make curtains of goats’ hair, to be a covering upon the Tabernacle, thou shalt make them to the number of eleven curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of a curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of a curtain four cubits: the eleven curtains shall be of one measure.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt couple five curtains by themselves, and the six curtains by themselves: but thou shalt double the sixth curtain upon the forefront of the covering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make fifty strings in the edge of one curtain in the selvedge of the coupling, and fifty strings in the edge of the other curtain in the second coupling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise thou shalt make fifty taches of brass, and fasten them on the strings, and shalt couple the covering together that it may be one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the remnant that resteth in the curtains of the covering, even the half curtain that resteth, shall be left at the backside of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: That the cubit on the one side, and the cubit on the other side of that which is left in the length of the curtains of the covering may remain on either side of the Tabernacle to cover it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, for that covering thou shalt make a covering of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers’ skins above.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make boards for the Tabernacle of Shittim wood to stand up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and an half cubit the breadth of one board.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two tenons shall be in one board set in order as the feet of a Ladder, one against another: thus shalt thou make for all the boards of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make boards for the Tabernacle, even twenty boards on the South side, even full South.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards, two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
speaker: Narrator

text: In like manner on the other side of the Tabernacle toward the North side shall be twenty boards,
speaker: Narrator

text: And their forty sockets of silver, two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the side of the Tabernacle, toward the West, shalt thou make six boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also two boards shalt thou make in the corners of the Tabernacle in the two sides.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they shall be joined beneath, and likewise they shall be joined above to a ring: thus shall it be for them two: they shall be for the two corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shall be eight boards having sockets of silver, even sixteen sockets, that is, two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt make five bars of Shittim wood for the boards of one side of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And five bars for the boards of the other side of the Tabernacle: also five bars for the boards of the side of the Tabernacle toward the West side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the middle bar shall go through the midst of the boards, from end to end.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cover the boards with gold, and make their rings of gold, for places for the bars, and thou shalt cover the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: So thou shalt rear up the Tabernacle, according to the fashion thereof, which was showed thee in the Mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, thou shalt make a veil of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, thou shalt make it of broidered work with Cherubims.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of Shittim wood covered with gold, (whose hooks shall be of gold) standing upon four sockets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward thou shalt hang the veil on the hooks, that thou mayest bring in thither, that is, within the veil, the Ark of the Testimony: and the veil shall make you a separation between the Holy place and the most holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt put the Mercy seat upon the Ark of the Testimony in the most Holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set the Table without the veil, and the Candlestick over against the Table on the South side of the Tabernacle, and thou shalt set the Table on the North side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make an hanging for the door of the Tabernacle of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen wrought with needle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make for the hanging five pillars of Shittim, and cover them with gold: their heads shall be of gold, and thou shalt cast five sockets of brass for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover thou shalt make the Altar of Shittim wood, five cubits long and five cubits broad (the altar shall be four square) and the height thereof three cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make it horns in the four corners thereof: the horns shall be of itself, and thou shalt cover it with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make his ash pans for his ashes, and his besoms, and his basins, and his flesh-hooks, and his censers: thou shalt make all the instruments thereof of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make unto it a grate, like network of brass: also upon that grate shalt thou make four brazen rings upon the four corners thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put it under the compass of the altar beneath, that the grate may be in the midst of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make bars for the altar, bars, I say, of Shittim wood, and shalt cover them with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the bars thereof shall be put in the rings, the which bars shall be upon the two sides of the altar to bear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make the altar hollow between the boards: as God showeth thee in the mount, so shall they make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make the court of the Tabernacle in the South side, even full South: the court shall have curtains of fine twined linen, of an hundred cubits long, for one side,
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall have twenty pillars, with their twenty sockets of brass: the heads of the pillars, and their fillets shall be silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise on the North side in length there shall be hangings of an hundred cubits long, and the twenty pillars thereof with their twenty sockets of brass: the heads of the pillars and the fillets shall be silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the breadth of the court, on the West side shall have curtains of fifty cubits, with their ten pillars, and their ten sockets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the breadth of the court, Eastward full East, shall have fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also hangings of fifteen cubits shall be on the one side with their three pillars and their three sockets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise on the other side shall be hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three sockets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the gate of the court shall be a veil of twenty cubits of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen wrought with needle, with the four pillars thereof and their four sockets.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the pillars of the court shall have fillets of silver round about, with their heads of silver, and their sockets of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the court shall be an hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty at either end, and the height five cubits, and the hangings of fine twined linen, and their sockets of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the vessels of the Tabernacle for all manner service thereof, and all the pins thereof, and all the pins of the court shall be brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure oil olive beaten for the light, that the lamps may always burn.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the Tabernacle of the Congregation without the veil, which is before the Testimony, shall Aaron and his sons dress them from evening to morning before the Lord, for a statute forever unto their generations, to be observed by the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And cause thou thy brother Aaron to come unto thee, and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may serve me in the Priest’s office: I mean, Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar Aaron’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, glorious and beautiful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt speak unto all cunning men, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they make Aaron’s garments to consecrate him, that he may serve me in the Priest’s office.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these shall be the garments, which they shall make, a breastplate, and an Ephod, and a robe, and a broidered coat, a mitre, and a girdle: so these holy garments shall they make for Aaron thy brother, and for his sons, that he may serve me in the Priest’s office.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they shall take gold, and blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall make the Ephod of gold, blue silk, and purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen of broidered work.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two shoulders thereof shall be joined together by their two edges: so shall it be closed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the embroidered girdle of the same Ephod, which shall be upon him, shall be of the selfsame work and stuff, even of gold, blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take two Onyx stones, and grave upon them the names of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six names of them upon the one stone, and the six names that remain, upon the second stone, according to their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt cause to grave the two stones according to the names of the children of Israel, by a graver of signets that worketh and graveth in stone, and shalt make them to be set and embossed in gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put the two stones upon the shoulders of the Ephod, as stones of remembrance of the children of Israel: for Aaron shall bear their names before the Lord upon his two shoulders for a remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: So thou shalt make bosses of gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: And two chains of fine gold at the end, of wreathen work shalt thou make them, and shalt fasten the wreathen chains upon the bosses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make the breastplate of judgment with broidered work: like the work of the Ephod shalt thou make it: of gold, blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen shalt thou make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Foursquare it shall be and double, an hand breadth long and an hand breadth broad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt set it full of places for stones, even four rows of stones: the order shall be this, a ruby, a topaz, and a carbuncle in the first row.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the second row thou shalt set an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the third row a turquoise, an agate, and an Hematite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the fourth row a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper: and they shall be set in gold in their embossments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the stones shall be according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, graven as signets, every one after his name, and they shall be for the twelve tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt make upon the breastplate two chains at the ends, of wreathen work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make also upon the breastplate two rings of gold, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings in the ends of the breastplate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the other two ends of the two wreathen chains, thou shalt fasten in the two embossments, and shalt put them upon the shoulders of the Ephod upon the foreside of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make two rings of gold, which thou shalt put in the two other ends of the breastplate, upon the border thereof, toward the inside of the Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: And two other rings of gold thou shalt make, and put them on the two sides of the Ephod, beneath in the forepart of it over against the coupling of it upon the broidered girdle of the Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall they bind the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the Ephod, with a lace of blue silk, that it may be fast upon the broidered girdle of the Ephod, and that the breastplate be not loosed from the Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment upon his heart, when he goeth into the holy place for a remembrance continually before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt put in the breastplate of judgment, the Urim and the Thummim, which shall be upon Aaron’s heart, when he goeth in before the Lord, and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel upon his heart before the Lord continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt make the robe of the Ephod altogether of blue silk.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hole for his head shall be in the midst of it, having an edge of woven work round about the collar of it: so shall it be as the collar of an habergeon, that it rent not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And beneath upon the skirts thereof, thou shalt make pomegranates of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet round about the skirts thereof, and bells of gold between them round about:
speaker: Narrator

text: That is, a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate round about upon the skirts of the robe.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall it be upon Aaron, when he ministereth, and his sound shall be heard when he goeth into the holy place before the Lord, and when he cometh out, and he shall not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make a plate of pure gold, and grave thereon, as signets are graven, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put it on a blue silk lace, and it shall be upon the mitre, even upon the forefront of the mitre shall it be.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall it be upon Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the offerings, which the children of Israel shall offer in all their holy offerings: and it shall be always upon his forehead, to make them acceptable before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise thou shalt embroider the fine linen coat, and thou shalt make a mitre of fine linen, but thou shalt make a girdle of needle work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt make for Aaron’s sons coats, and thou shalt make them girdles, and bonnets shalt thou make them for glory and comeliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put them upon Aaron thy brother, and on his sons with him, and shalt anoint them, and fill their hands, and sanctify them, that they may minister unto me in the Priest’s office.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make them linen breeches to cover their privities: from the loins unto the thighs shall they reach.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be for Aaron and his sons, when they come into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, or when they come unto the altar to minister in the holy place, that they commit not iniquity, and so die. This shall be a law forever unto him, and to his seed after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This thing also shalt thou do unto them, when thou consecratest them to be my Priests, Take a young calf, and two rams without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: And unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: (of fine wheat flour shalt thou make them).
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt put them in one basket, and present them in the basket with the calf and the two rams,
speaker: Narrator

text: And shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and wash them with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt take the garments, and put upon Aaron the tunicle, and the robe of the Ephod, and the Ephod, and the breastplate, and shalt close them to him with the broidered girdle of the Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt put the mitre upon his head, and shalt put the holy crown upon the mitre.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and shalt pour upon his head and anoint him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And shalt gird them with girdles, both Aaron and his sons: and shalt put the bonnets on them, and the Priest’s office shall be theirs for a perpetual law: thou shalt also fill the hands of Aaron, and the hands of his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, thou shalt present the calf before the Tabernacle of the congregation, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the calf.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shalt thou kill the calf before the Lord, at the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt take of the blood of the calf, and put it upon the horns of the Altar with thy finger, and shalt pour all the rest of the blood at the foot of the Altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul, that is on the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and shalt burn them upon the Altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the flesh of the calf, and his skin, and his dung shalt thou burn with fire without the host: it is a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also take one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt kill the ram, and take his blood, and sprinkle it round about upon the Altar,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt cut the ram in pieces, and wash the inwards of him and his legs, and shalt put them upon the pieces thereof, and upon his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: So thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the Altar: for it is a burnt offering unto the Lord for a sweet savor: it is an offering made by fire unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And shalt thou take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou kill the ram, and take of his blood, and put it upon the lap of Aaron’s ear, and upon the lap of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and shalt sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the Altar, and of the anointing oil, and shalt sprinkle it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: so he shall be hallowed, and his clothes, and his sons, and the garments of his sons with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt take of the rams the fat and the rump, even the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul of the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder, (for it is the ram of consecration).
speaker: Narrator

text: And one loaf of bread, and one cake of bread tempered with oil, and one wafer, out of the basket of the unleavened bread that is before the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put all this in the hands of Aaron, and in the hands of his sons, and shalt shake them to and fro before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, thou shalt receive them of their hands, and burn them upon the altar besides the burnt offering for a sweet savor before the Lord: for this is an offering made by fire unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise thou shalt take the breast of the ram of the consecration, which is for Aaron, and shalt shake it to and fro before the Lord, and it shall be thy part.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt sanctify the breast of the shaken offering, and the shoulder of the heave offering, which was shaken to and fro, and which was heaved up of the ram of the consecration which was for Aaron, and which was for his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron and his sons shall have it by a statute forever, of the children of Israel: for it is an heave offering, and it shall be an heave offering of the children of Israel, of their peace offerings, even their heave offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the holy garments which appertain to Aaron, shall be his sons’ after him, to be anointed therein, and to be consecrated therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: That son that shall be Priest in his stead, shall put them on seven days, when he cometh into the Tabernacle of the Congregation to minister in the holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: So thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shall eat these things, whereby their atonement was made, to consecrate them, and to sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat thereof, because they are holy things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if ought of the flesh of the consecration, or of the bread remain unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the rest with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is an holy thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore shalt thou do thus unto Aaron and unto his sons, according to all things which I have commanded thee: seven days shalt thou consecrate them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And shalt offer every day a calf for a sin offering, for reconciliation: and thou shalt cleanse the Altar, when thou hast offered upon it for reconciliation, and shalt anoint it to sanctify it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven days shalt thou cleanse the Altar and sanctify it, so the Altar shall be most holy: and whatsoever toucheth the Altar, shall be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is that which thou shalt present upon the altar: even two lambs of one year old, day by day continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one lamb thou shalt present in the morning, and the other lamb thou shalt present at even.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with the one lamb, a tenth part of fine flour mingled with the fourth part of an Hin of beaten oil, and the fourth part of an Hin of wine for a drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the other lamb thou shalt present at even: thou shalt do thereto according to the offering of the morning, and according to the drink offering thereof, to be a burnt offering for a sweet savor unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be a continually burnt offering in your generations at the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation before the Lord, where I will make appointment with you, to speak there unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: There I will appoint with the children of Israel, and the place shall be sanctified by my glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will sanctify the Tabernacle of the Congregation and the Altar: I will sanctify also Aaron and his sons to be my Priests,
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall they know that I am the Lord their God, that brought them out of the land of Egypt, that I might dwell among them: I am the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore thou shalt make an Altar for sweet perfume, of Shittim wood thou shalt make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length thereof a cubit, and the breadth thereof a cubit, (it shall be foursquare) and the height thereof two cubits: the horns thereof shall be of the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt overlay it with fine gold, both the top thereof, and the sides thereof round about, and his horns: also thou shalt make unto it a crown of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Besides this thou shalt make under this crown two golden rings on either side: even on every side shalt thou make them, that they may be as places for the bars to bear it withal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The which bars thou shalt make of Shittim wood, and shalt cover them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: After thou shalt set it before the veil, that is near the Ark of the Testimony, before the Mercy seat that is upon the Testimony, where I will appoint with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron shall burn thereon sweet incense every morning: when he dresseth the lamps thereof, shall he burn it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise at even, when Aaron setteth up the lamps thereof, he shall burn incense: this perfume shall be perpetually before the Lord, throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall offer no strange incense thereon, nor burnt sacrifice, nor offering, neither pour any drink offering thereon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron shall make reconciliation upon the horns of it once in a year with the blood of the sin offering in the day of reconciliation: once in the year shall he make reconciliation upon it throughout your generations: this is most holy unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou takest the sum of the children of Israel after their number, then they shall give every man a redemption of his life unto the Lord, when thou tellest them, that there be no plague among them when thou countest them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall every man give, that goeth into the number, half a shekel, after the shekel of the Sanctuary: (a shekel is twenty gerahs) the half shekel shall be an offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that are numbered from twenty years old and above, shall give an offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich shall not pass, and the poor shall not diminish from half a shekel, when ye shall give an offering unto the Lord, for the redemption of your lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: So thou shalt take the money of the redemption of the children of Israel, and shalt put it unto the use of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, that it may be a memorial unto the children of Israel before the Lord, for the redemption of your lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also make a Laver of brass, and his foot of brass to wash, and shalt put it between the Tabernacle of the Congregation and the Altar, and shalt put water therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands, and their feet thereat.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they go into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, or when they go unto the Altar to minister, and to make the perfume of the burnt offering to the Lord, they shall wash themselves with water, lest they die.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they shall wash their hands and their feet that they die not: and this shall be to them an ordinance forever, both unto him and to his seed throughout their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take thou also unto thee principal spices: of the most pure myrrh five hundred shekels, of sweet cinnamon half so much, that is, two hundred and fifty, and of sweet calamus, two hundred, and fifty:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also of Cassia five hundred, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, and of oil olive an Hin.
speaker: Narrator

text: So thou shalt make of it the oil of holy ointment, even a most precious ointment after the art of the Apothecary: this shall be the oil of holy ointment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt anoint the Tabernacle of the Congregation therewith, and the Ark of the Testimony:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Table, and all the instruments thereof, and the Candlestick, with all the instruments thereof, and the altar of incense:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the altar of burnt offering with all his instruments, and the laver and his foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: So thou shalt sanctify them, and they shall be most holy: all that shall touch them, shall be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also anoint Aaron and his sons, and shalt consecrate them, that they may minister unto me in the Priest’s office.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, This shall be an holy anointing oil unto me, throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: None shall anoint man’s flesh therewith, neither shall ye make any composition like unto it: for it is holy, and shall be holy unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever shall make the like ointment, or whosoever shall put any of it upon a stranger, even he shall be cut off from his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Take unto thee these spices, pure myrrh and clear gum and galbanum, these odors with pure frankincense of each like weight:
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt make of them perfume composed after the art of the apothecary, mingled together, pure and holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt beat it to powder, and shalt put it before the Ark of the Testimony in the tabernacle of the congregation, where I will make appointment with thee: it shall be unto you most holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall not make unto you any composition like this perfume, which thou shalt make: it shall be unto thee holy for the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever shall make like unto that to smell thereto, even he shall be cut off from his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Whom I have filled with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all workmanship:
speaker: Narrator

text: To find out curious works to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
speaker: Narrator

text: Also in the art to set stones, and to carve in timber, and to work in all manner of workmanship.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, I have joined him with Aholiab the son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan, and in the hearts of all that are wise hearted, have I put wisdom to make all that I have commanded thee:
speaker: Narrator

text: That is, the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the Ark of the Testimony, and the Mercy seat that shall be thereupon, with all instruments of the Tabernacle:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Table and the instruments thereof, and the pure Candlestick with all his instruments, and the Altar of perfume:
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise the Altar of burnt offering with all his instruments, and the Laver with his foot:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the garments of the ministration, and the holy garment for Aaron the Priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the Priest’s office,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anointing oil, and sweet perfume for the Sanctuary according to all that I have commanded thee, shall they do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak thou also unto the children of Israel, and say, Notwithstanding keep ye my Sabbaths: for it is a sign between me and you in your generations, that ye may know that I the Lord do sanctify you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall therefore keep the Sabbath: for it is holy unto you: he that defileth it, shall die the death: therefore whosoever worketh therein, the same person shall be even cut off from among his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shall men work, but in the seventh day is the Sabbath of the holy rest to the Lord: whosoever doeth any work in the Sabbath day, shall die the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore the children of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, that they may observe the rest throughout their generations for an everlasting Covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a sign between me and the children of Israel forever: for in six days the Lord made the heaven and the earth, and in the seventh day he ceased and rested.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus (when the Lord had made an end of communing with Moses upon mount Sinai) he gave him two Tables of the Testimony, even tables of stone, written with the finger of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the people saw, that Moses tarried long ere he came down from the mountain, the people gathered themselves together against Aaron, and said unto him, Up, make us gods to go before us: for of this Moses (the man that brought us out of the land of Egypt) we know not what is become of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron said unto them, Pluck off the golden earrings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people plucked from themselves the golden earrings, which were in their ears, and they brought them unto Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who received them at their hands, and fashioned it with the graving tool, and made of it a molten calf: then they said, These be thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Aaron saw that, he made an Altar before it: and Aaron proclaimed, saying, Tomorrow shall be the holy day of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they rose up the next day in the morning, and offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings: also the people sat them down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Moses, Go get thee down: for thy people which thou hast brought out of the land of Egypt, hath corrupted their ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are soon turned out of the way, which I commanded them: for they have made them a molten calf, and have worshipped it, and have offered thereto, saying, These be thy gods, O Israel, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Lord said unto Moses, I have seen this people, and behold, it is a stiff-necked people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore let me alone, that my wrath may wax hot against them, for I will consume them: but I will make of thee a mighty people
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses prayed unto the Lord his God, and said, O Lord, why doth thy wrath wax hot against thy people, which thou hast brought out of the land of Egypt, with great power and with a mighty hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore shall the Egyptians speak, and say, He hath brought them out maliciously for to slay them in the mountains, and to consume them from the earth? turn from thy fierce wrath, and change thy mind from this evil toward thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel thy servants, to whom thou swarest by thine own self, and saidest unto them, I will multiply your seed, as the stars of heaven, and all this land, that I have spoken of, will I give unto your seed, and they shall inherit it forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord changed his mind from the evil, which he threatened to do unto his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses returned and went down from the mountain with the two Tables of the Testimony in his hand: the tables were written on both their sides, even on the one side and on the other were they written.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these Tables were the work of God, and this writing was the writing of God graven in the Tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joshua heard the noise of the people, as they shouted, he said unto Moses, There is a noise of war in the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who answered, It is not the noise of them that have the victory, nor the noise of them that are overcome: but I do hear the noise of singing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, as soon as he came near unto the host, he saw the calf and the dancing: so Moses’ wrath waxed hot, and he cast the Tables out of his hands, and brake them in pieces beneath the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, he took the calf, which they had made, and burned it in the fire, and ground it unto powder, and strowed it upon the water, and made the children of Israel drink of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Moses said unto Aaron, What did this people unto thee, that thou hast brought so great a sin upon them?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron answered, Let not the wrath of my Lord wax fierce: Thou knowest this people, that they are even set on mischief.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto me, Make us gods to go before us: for we know not what is become of this Moses (the man that brought us out of the land of Egypt).
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said to them, Ye that have gold, pluck it off: and they brought it me, and I did cast it into the fire, and thereof came this calf.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses therefore saw that the people were naked (for Aaron had made them naked unto their shame among their enemies)
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses stood in the gate of the camp, and said, Who pertaineth to the Lord? let them come to me. And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto them, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel: Put every man his sword by his side, go to and fro, from gate to gate, through the host, and slay every man his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Levi did as Moses had commanded: and there fell of the people the same day about three thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For Moses had said, Consecrate your hands unto the Lord this day, even every man upon his son, and upon his brother, that there may be given you a blessing this day.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the morning came, Moses said unto the people, Ye have committed a grievous crime: but now I will go up to the Lord, if I may pacify him for your sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses therefore went again unto the Lord, and said, Oh, this people have sinned a great sin, and have made them gods of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now if thou pardon their sin, thy mercy shall appear: but if thou wilt not, I pray thee, raise me out of thy book, which thou hast written.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, Whosoever hath sinned against me, I will put him out of my book.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go now therefore, bring the people unto the place which I commanded thee: behold, mine Angel shall go before thee, but yet in the day of my visitation I will visit their sin upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord plagued the people, because they caused Aaron to make the calf which he made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the Lord said unto Moses, Depart, go up from hence, thou, and the people (which thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt) unto the land which I sware unto Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, Unto thy seed will I give it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send an Angel before thee, and will cast out the Canaanites, the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites,
speaker: Narrator

text: To a land, I say, that floweth with milk and honey: for I will not go up with thee, because thou art a stiff-necked people, lest I consume thee in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the people heard this evil tidings, they sorrowed, and no man put on his best raiment.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the Lord had said unto Moses, Say unto the children of Israel, Ye are a stiff-necked people, I will come suddenly upon thee and consume thee: therefore now put thy costly raiment from thee, that I may know what to do unto thee.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Israel laid their good raiment from them, after Moses came down from the mount Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses took his tabernacle, and pitched it without the host far off from the host, and called it Ohel-moed. And when any did seek to the Lord, he went out unto the Tabernacle of the Congregation, which was without the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses went out unto the Tabernacle, all the people rose up, and stood every man at his tent door, and looked after Moses, until he was gone into the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as Moses was entered into the Tabernacle, the cloudy pillar descended and stood at the door of the Tabernacle, and the Lord talked with Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when all the people saw the cloudy pillar stand at the Tabernacle door, all the people rose up, and worshipped every man in his tent door.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake unto Moses, face to face, as a man speaketh unto his friend. After he turned again into the host, but his servant Joshua the son of Nun a young man, departed not out of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said unto the Lord, See, thou sayest unto me, Lead this people forth, and thou hast not showed me whom thou wilt send with me: thou hast said moreover, I know thee by name, and thou hast also found grace in my sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found favor in thy sight, show me now thy way, that I may know thee, and that I may find grace in thy sight: consider also that this nation is thy people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said unto him, If thy presence go not with us, carry us not hence.
speaker: Narrator

text: And wherein now shall it be known, that I and thy people have found favor in thy sight? shall it not be when thou goest with us? so I, and thy people shall have preeminence before all the people that are upon the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, I will do this also that thou hast said: for thou hast found grace in my sight, and I know thee by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he said, I beseech thee, show me thy glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, I will make all my good go before thee, and I will proclaim the Name of the Lord before thee: for I will show mercy to whom I will show mercy, and will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore he said, Thou canst not see my face, for there shall no man see me, and live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Lord said, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand upon the rock:
speaker: Narrator

text: And while my glory passeth by, I will put thee in a cleft of the rock, and will cover thee with mine hand while I pass by.
speaker: Narrator

text: After I will take away mine hand, and thou shalt see my back parts: but my face shall not be seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Hew thee two Tables of stone, like unto the first, and I will write upon the Tables the words that were in the first Tables, which thou brakest in pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: And be ready in the morning, that thou mayest come up early unto the mount of Sinai, and wait there for me in the top of the mount.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let no man come up with thee, neither let any man be seen throughout all the mount; neither let the sheep nor cattle feed before this mount.
