speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses hewed two Tables of stone like unto the first, and rose up early in the morning, and went up unto the mount of Sinai, as the Lord had commanded him, and took in his hand two Tables of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord passed before his face, and cried, The Lord, the Lord, strong, merciful, and gracious, slow to anger, and abundant in goodness and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reserving mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity, and transgression and sin, and not making the wicked innocent, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon children’s children, unto the third and fourth generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses made haste and bowed himself to the earth, and worshipped,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said, O Lord, I pray thee, If I have found grace in thy sight, that the Lord would now go with us (for it is a stiff-necked people) and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, Behold, I will make a covenant before all thy people, and will do marvels, such as have not been done in all the world, neither in all nations: and all the people among whom thou art, shall see the work of the Lord: for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep diligently that which I command thee this day: Behold, I will cast out before thee the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed to thyself, that thou make no compact with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest they be the cause of ruin among you:
speaker: Narrator

text: But ye shall overthrow their altars, and break their images in pieces, and cut down their groves,
speaker: Narrator

text: (For thou shalt bow down to none other god, because the Lord, whose Name is Jealous, is a jealous God.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest thou make a compact with the inhabitants of the land, and when they go a whoring after their gods, and do sacrifice unto their gods, some man call thee, and thou eat of his sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And lest thou take of their daughters unto thy sons, and their daughters go a whoring after their gods, and make thy sons go a whoring after their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt make thee no gods of metal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep: seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, in the time of the month of Abib: for in the month of Abib thou camest out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every male that first openeth the womb, shall be mine: also all the firstborn of thy flock shall be reckoned mine, both of beeves and sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the first of the ass thou shalt buy out with a lamb: and if thou redeem him not, then thou shalt break his neck: all the firstborn of thy sons shalt thou redeem, and none shall appear before meempty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shalt thou work, and in the seventh day thou shalt rest: both in earing time, and in the harvest thou shalt rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also observe the feast of weeks in the time of the firstfruits, of wheat harvest, and the feast of gathering fruits in the end of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thrice in a year shall all your men children appear before the Lord Jehovah God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will cast out the nations before thee and enlarge thy coasts, so that no man shall desire thy land, when thou shalt come up to appear before the Lord thy God thrice in the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leaven, neither shall ought of the sacrifice of the feast of Passover be left unto the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first ripe fruits of thy land thou shalt bring unto the house of the Lord thy God: yet shalt thou not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Moses, Write thou these words: for after the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with thee and with Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he was there with the Lord forty days and forty nights, and did neither eat bread nor drink water, and he wrote in the Tables the words of the covenant, even the Ten commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when Moses came down from mount Sinai, the two Tables of the Testimony were in Moses’ hand, as he descended from the mount: (now Moses wist not that the skin of his face shone bright, after that God had talked with him).
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron and all the children of Israel looked upon Moses, and behold, the skin of his face shone bright, and they were afraid to come near him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses called them: and Aaron and all the chief of the congregation returned unto him: and Moses talked with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward all the children of Israel came near, and he charged them with all that the Lord had said unto him in mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses made an end of communing with them, and had put a covering upon his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: But, when Moses came before the Lord to speak with him, he took off the covering until he came out: then he came out, and spake unto the children of Israel that which he was commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel saw the face of Moses, how the skin of Moses’ face shone bright: therefore Moses put the covering upon his face, until he went to speak with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses assembled all the Congregation of the children of Israel, and said unto them, These are the words which the Lord hath commanded, that ye should do them:
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days thou shalt work, but the seventh day shall be unto you the holy Sabbath of rest unto the Lord: whosoever doeth any work therein, shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall kindle no fire throughout all your habitations upon the Sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again, Moses spake unto all the Congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the Lord commandeth, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take from among you an offering unto the Lord: whosoever is of a willing heart, let him bring this offering to the Lord, namely gold, and silver and brass:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats’ hair,
speaker: Narrator

text: And rams’ skins dyed red, and badgers’ skins with Shittim wood:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also oil for light, and spices for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: And onyx stones, and stones to be set in the Ephod, and in the breastplate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the wise hearted among you, shall come and make all that the Lord hath commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: That is, the Tabernacle, the pavilion thereof, and his covering, and his taches, and his boards, his bars, his pillars, and his sockets,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Ark, and the bars thereof: the Mercy seat, and the veil that covereth it,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Table, and the bars of it, and all the instruments thereof, and the showbread:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Candlestick of light and his instruments, and his lamps with the oil for the light:
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise the Altar of perfume and his bars, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the veil of the door at the entering in of the Tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Altar of burnt offering with his brazen grate, his bars and all his instruments, the laver and his foot,
speaker: Narrator

text: The hangings of the court, his pillars and his sockets, and the veil of the gate of the court,
speaker: Narrator

text: The pins of the Tabernacle, and the pins of the court with their cords,
speaker: Narrator

text: The ministering garments to minister in the holy place, and the holy garments of Aaron the Priest, and the garments of his sons, that they may minister in the Priest’s office.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the Congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And every one, whose heart encouraged him, and every one, whose spirit made him willing, came and brought an offering to the Lord, for the work of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and for all his uses, and for the holy garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both men and women, as many as were free hearted, came and brought taches and earrings, and rings, and bracelets, all were jewels of gold: and every one that offered an offering of gold unto the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man also, which had blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen and goats’ hair, and rams’ skins dyed red, and badgers’ skins, brought them.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that offered an oblation of silver and of brass, brought the offering unto the Lord: and every one, that had Shittim wood for any manner work of the ministration, brought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the women that were wise-hearted, did spin with their hands, and brought the spun work, even the blue silk, and the purple, the scarlet, and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise all the women, whose hearts were moved with knowledge, spun goats’ hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rulers brought onyx stones, and stones to be set in the Ephod, and in the breastplate:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also spice, and oil for light, and for the anointing oil, and for the sweet perfume.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man and woman of the children of Israel, whose hearts moved them willingly to bring for all the work which the Lord had commanded them to make by the hand of Moses, brought a free offering unto the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said unto the children of Israel, Behold, the Lord hath called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur of the tribe of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And hath filled him with an excellent spirit of wisdom, of understanding, and of knowledge, and in all manner work,
speaker: Narrator

text: To find out curious works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
speaker: Narrator

text: And in graving stones to set them, and in carving of wood, even to make any manner of fine work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he hath put in his heart that he may teach other: both he, and Aholiab the son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan:
speaker: Narrator

text: Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart to work all manner of cunning and broidered, and needle work: in blue silk, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen and weaving, even to do all manner of work and subtle inventions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then wrought Bezalel, and Aholiab, and all cunning men, to whom the Lord gave wisdom, and understanding, to know how to work all manner work for the service of the Sanctuary, according to all that the Lord had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Moses had called Bezalel, and Aholiab, and all the wise-hearted men, in whose hearts the Lord had given wisdom, even as many as their hearts encouraged to come unto that work to work it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they received of Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the Sanctuary, to make it: also they brought still unto him free gifts every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the wise men, that wrought all the holy work, came every man from his work which they wrought,
speaker: Narrator

text: And spake to Moses, saying, The people bring too much, and more than enough for the use of the work, which the Lord hath commanded to be made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses gave a commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the host, saying, Let neither man nor woman prepare any more work for the oblations of the Sanctuary. So the people were stayed from offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the stuff they had, was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cunning men therefore among the workmen, made for the Tabernacle ten curtains of fine twined linen, and of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet: Cherubims of broidered work made they upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and the curtains were all of one size.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he coupled five curtains together, and another five coupled he together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made strings of blue silk by the edge of one curtain, in the selvedge of the coupling: likewise he made on the side of the other curtain in the selvedge in the second coupling.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fifty strings made he in the one curtain, and fifty strings made he in the edge of the other curtain, which was in the second coupling: the strings were set one against another.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, he made fifty taches of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the taches: so was it one Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made curtains of goats’ hair for the covering upon the Tabernacle: he made them to the number of eleven curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of one curtain had thirty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the eleven curtains were of one size.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made fifty strings upon the edge of one curtain in the selvedge in the coupling, and fifty strings made he upon the edge of the other curtain in the second coupling.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made also fifty taches of brass to couple the covering that it might be one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made a covering upon the pavilion of rams’ skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers’ skins above.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise he made the boards for the Tabernacle, of Shittim wood to stand up.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of a board was ten cubits, and the breadth of one board was a cubit and an half.
speaker: Narrator

text: One board had two tenons, set in order as the feet of a ladder, one against another: thus made he for all the boards of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he made twenty boards for the South side of the Tabernacle, even full South.
speaker: Narrator

text: And forty sockets of silver made he under the twenty boards, two sockets under one board for his two tenons, and two sockets under another board for his two tenons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also for the other side of the Tabernacle toward the North, he made twenty boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their forty sockets of silver, two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise toward the West side of the Tabernacle he made six boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: And two boards made he in the corners of the Tabernacle for either side,
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were joined beneath, and likewise were made sure above with a ring: thus he did to both in both corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: So there were eight boards, and their sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, he made bars of Shittim wood, five for the boards in the one side of the Tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: And five bars for the boards in the other side of the Tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the Tabernacle on the side toward the West.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards, from the one end to the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid also the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for places for the bars, and covered the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover he made a veil of blue silk and purple, and of scarlet, and of fine twined linen: with Cherubims of broidered work made he it:
speaker: Narrator

text: And made thereunto four pillars of Shittim, and overlaid them with gold: whose hooks were also of gold, and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made an hanging for the Tabernacle door, of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, and needle work,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the five pillars of it with their hooks, and overlaid their chapiters, and their fillets with gold, but their five sockets were of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Bezalel made the Ark of Shittim wood, two cubits and an half long, and a cubit and an half broad, and a cubit and an half high:
speaker: Narrator

text: And overlaid it with fine gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about,
speaker: Narrator

text: And cast for it four rings of gold for the four corners of it: that is, two rings for the one side of it, and two rings for the other side thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made bars of Shittim wood, and covered them with gold,
speaker: Narrator

text: And put the bars in the rings by the sides of the Ark, to bear the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the Mercy seat of pure gold: two cubits and an half was the length thereof, and one cubit and an half the breadth thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made two Cherubims of gold, upon the two ends of the Mercy seat: even of work beaten with the hammer made he them.
speaker: Narrator

text: One Cherub on the one end, and another Cherub on the other end: of the Mercy seat made he the Cherubims, at the two ends thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Cherubims spread out their wings on high, and covered the Mercy seat with their wings and their faces were one towards another: toward the Mercy seat were the faces of the Cherubims.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made the Table of Shittim wood: two cubits was the length thereof and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and an half the height of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid it with fine gold, and made thereto a crown of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made thereto a border of an hand breadth round about, and made upon the border a crown of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that were in the four feet thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against the border were the rings, as places for the bars to bear the Table.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the bars of Shittim wood, and covered them with gold to bear the Table.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made the instruments for the Table of pure gold: dishes for it, and incense cups for it, and goblets for it, and coverings for it, wherewith it should be covered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise he made the Candlestick of pure gold: of work beaten out with the hammer made he the Candlestick: and his shaft, and his branch, his bowls, his knops, and his flowers were of one piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: And six branches came out of the sides thereof: three branches of the Candlestick out of the one side of it, and three branches of the Candlestick out of the other side of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In one branch three bowls made like almonds, a knop and a flower: and in another branch three bowls made like almonds, a knop and a flower: and so throughout the six branches that proceeded out of the Candlestick.
speaker: Narrator

text: And upon the Candlestick were four bowls after the fashion of almonds, the knops thereof and the flowers thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: That is, under every two branches a knop made thereof, and a knop under the second branch thereof, and a knop under the third branch thereof, according to the six branches coming out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their knops and their branches were of the same: it was all one beaten work of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for it seven lamps with the snuffers, and snuffdishes thereof of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of a talent of pure gold made he it with all the instruments thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore he made the perfume altar of Shittim wood: the length of it was a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit (it was square) and two cubits high, and the horns thereof were of the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he covered it with pure gold, both the top and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it, and made unto it a crown of gold round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made two rings of gold for it, under the crown thereof in the two corners of the two sides thereof, to put bars in for to bear it therewith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made the bars of Shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the holy anointing oil, and the sweet pure incense after the apothecary’s art.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made the altar of the burnt offering of Shittim wood: five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof: it was square and three cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made unto it horns in the four corners thereof: the horns thereof were of the same, and he overlaid it with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made all the instruments of the altar: the ashpans, and the besoms and the basins, the fleshhooks, and the censers: all the instruments thereof made he of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he made a brazen grate wrought like a net to the Altar, under the compass of it beneath in the midst of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And cast four rings of brass for the four ends of the grate to put bars in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the bars of Shittim wood, and covered them with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: The which bars he put into the rings on the sides of the altar to bear it withal, and made it hollow within the boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass of the glasses of the women that did assemble and came together at the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, he made the court on the South side full South: the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, having an hundred cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their pillars were twenty, and their brazen sockets twenty: the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the North side the hangings were an hundred cubits: their pillars twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty, the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the west side also were hangings of fifty cubits, their ten pillars with their ten sockets: the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And toward the East side, full East were hangings of fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hangings of the one side were fifteen cubits, their three pillars, and their three sockets:
speaker: Narrator

text: And of the other side of the court gate on both sides were hangings of fifteen cubits, with their three pillars and their three sockets.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the sockets of the pillars were of brass: the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver, and the covering of their chapiters of silver: and all the pillars of the court were hooped about with silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made also the hanging of the gate of the court of needle work, blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen even twenty cubits long, and five cubits in height and breadth, like the hangings of the court.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their pillars were four with their four sockets of brass: their hooks of silver, and the covering of the chapiters, and their fillets of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the pins of the Tabernacle and of the court round about were of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the parts of the Tabernacle, I mean, of the Tabernacle of the Testimony, which was appointed by the commandment of Moses for the office of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar son to Aaron the Priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur of the tribe of Judah, made all that the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with him Aholiab son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan, a cunning workman and an embroiderer, and a worker of needle work in blue silk, and in purple, and in scarlet, and in fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the gold that was occupied in all the work wrought for the holy place (which was the gold of the offering) was nine and twenty talents and seven hundred and thirty shekels, according to the shekel of the Sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the silver of them that were numbered in the Congregation, was an hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: A portion for a man, that is, half a shekel after the shekel of the Sanctuary, for all them that were numbered from twenty years old and above, among six hundred thousand, and three thousand, and five hundred and fifty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover there were an hundred talents of silver, to cast the sockets of the Sanctuary, and the sockets of the veil: an hundred sockets of an hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he made the hooks for the pillars of a thousand seven hundred and seventy and five shekels, and overlaid their chapiters, and made fillets about them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand, and four hundred shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whereof he made the sockets to the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the brazen altar, and the brazen grate which was for it, with all the instruments of the Altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets for the court gate, and all the pins of the Tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover they made garments of ministration to minister in the Sanctuary of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet: they made also the holy garments for Aaron, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he made the Ephod of gold, blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue silk and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, with broidered work.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the which they made shoulders to couple together: for it was closed by the two edges thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the broidered girdle of his Ephod that was upon him, was of the same stuff, and of like work: even of gold, of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they wrought two Onyx stones closed in ouches of gold, and graved, as signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And put them on the shoulders of the Ephod, as stones for a remembrance of the children of Israel, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he made the breastplate of broidered work like the work of the Ephod: to wit, of gold, blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made the breast plate double, and it was square an hand breadth long, and an hand breadth broad: it was also double.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they filled it with four rows of stones. The order was thus, a Ruby, a Topaz, and a Carbuncle in the first row.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the second row an Emerald, a Sapphire, and a Diamond:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also in the third row a Turquoise, an Agate, and an Hematite:
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise in the fourth row a Chrysolite, an Onyx, and a Jasper: closed and set in ouches of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, even twelve after their names, graven like signets, every one after his name, according to the twelve tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, they made upon the breastplate chains at the ends, of wreathen work and pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made also two bosses of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings in the two corners of the breastplate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings, in the corners of the breastplate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the two other ends of the two wreathen chains they fastened in the two bosses, and put them on the shoulders of the Ephod, upon the forefront of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise they made two rings of gold, and put them in the two other corners of the breastplate upon the edge of it, which was on the inside of the Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made also two other golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the Ephod, beneath on the foreside of it, and over against his coupling above the broidered girdle of the Ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they fastened the breastplate by his rings unto the rings of the Ephod, with a lace of blue silk that it might be fast upon the broidered girdle of the Ephod, and that the breastplate should not be loosed from the Ephod, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he made the robe of the Ephod of woven work, altogether of blue silk.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hole of the robe was in the midst of it, as the collar of an habergeon, with an edge about the collar, that it should not rent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made upon the skirt of the robe pomegranates, of blue silk and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen twined.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made also bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the skirts of the robe round about between the pomegranates.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate round about the skirts of the robe to minister in, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, they made coats of fine linen, of woven work for Aaron and for his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the mitre of fine linen, and goodly bonnets of fine linen, and linen breeches of fine twined linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the girdle of fine twined linen, and of blue silk, and purple, and scarlet, even of needle work, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, they made the plate for the holy crown of fine gold, and wrote upon it a superscription like to the graving of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they tied unto it a lace of blue silk to fasten it on high upon the mitre, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus was all the work of the Tabernacle, even of the Tabernacle of the Congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses: so did they.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward they brought the Tabernacle unto Moses, the Tabernacle and all his instruments, his taches, his boards, his bars, and his pillars, and his sockets,
speaker: Narrator

text: And the covering of rams’ skins, dyed red, and the coverings of badgers’ skins, and the covering veil.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Ark of the testimony, and the bars thereof, and the Mercy seat.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Table, with all the instruments thereof, and the showbread.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pure Candlestick, the lamps thereof, even the Lamps set in order, and all the instruments thereof, and the oil for light:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the golden Altar and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging of the Tabernacle door,
speaker: Narrator

text: The brazen Altar with his grate of brass, his bars and all his instruments, the Laver and his foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: The curtains of the court with his pillars, and his sockets, and the hanging to the court gate, and his cords, and his pins, and all the instruments of the service of the Tabernacle, called the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, the ministering garments to serve in the Sanctuary, and the holy garments for Aaron the Priest, and his sons’ garments to minister in the Priest’s office.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to every point that the Lord had commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses beheld all the work, and behold they had done it as the Lord had commanded: so had they done: and Moses blessed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spake unto Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: In the first day of the first month in the very first of the same month shalt thou set up the Tabernacle, called the Tabernacle of the Congregation:
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put therein the Ark of the Testimony, and cover the Ark with the veil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt bring in the Table, and set it in order as it doth require: thou shalt also bring in the Candlestick, and light his lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set the incense Altar of gold before the Ark of the Testimony; and put the hanging at the door of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, thou shalt set the burnt offering Altar before the door of the Tabernacle, called the Tabernacle of the Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt set the Laver between the Tabernacle of the Congregation and the Altar, and put water therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt appoint the court round about, and hang up the hanging at the court gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the Tabernacle, and all that is therein, and hallow it with all the instruments thereof, that it may be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt anoint the Altar of the burnt offering, and all his instruments, and shalt sanctify the Altar, that it may be an altar most holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt anoint the Laver, and his foot, and shalt sanctify it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and wash them with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments, and shalt anoint him, and sanctify him, that he may minister unto me in the Priest’s office.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt also bring his sons and clothe them with garments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And shalt anoint them as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto me in the Priest’s office: for their anointing shall be a sign, that the Priesthood shall be everlasting unto them throughout their generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses did according to all that the Lord had commanded him; so did he.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus was the Tabernacle reared up the first day of the first month in the second year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses reared up the Tabernacle and fastened his sockets, and set up the boards thereof, and put in the bars of it, and reared up his pillars.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spread the covering over the Tabernacle, and put the covering of that covering on high above it, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took and put the Testimony in the Ark, and put the bars in the rings of the Ark, and set the Mercy seat on high upon the Ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought also the Ark into the Tabernacle, and hanged up the covering veil, and covered the Ark of the Testimony, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore he put the Table in the Tabernacle of the Congregation in the North side of the Tabernacle, without the veil,
speaker: Narrator

text: And set the bread in order before the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he put the Candlestick in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, over against the Table toward the South side of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lighted the lamps before the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, he set the golden Altar in the Tabernacle of the Congregation before the veil,
speaker: Narrator

text: And burnt sweet incense thereon, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he hanged up the veil at the door of the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, he set the burnt offering Altar without the door of the Tabernacle, called the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and offered the burnt offering and the sacrifice thereon, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise he set the Laver between the Tabernacle of the Congregation and the Altar, and poured water therein to wash with.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses and Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and their feet thereat.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and when they approached to the Altar, they washed, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, he reared up the court round about the Tabernacle and the Altar, and hanged up the veil at the court gate: so Moses finished the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the cloud covered the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the glory of the Lord filled the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses could not enter into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, because the cloud abode thereon, and the glory of the Lord filled the Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the cloud ascended up from the Tabernacle, the children of Israel went forward in all their journeys.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the cloud ascended not, then they journeyed not till the day that it ascended.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cloud of the Lord was upon the Tabernacle by day, and fire was in it by night in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
speaker: Narrator
